Content:
Amazon.com Services LLC
3.8
QA Engineer, Prime Gaming, Engineering QA Team
Remote

 ● 5+ years of QA experience and knowledge of QA tools and methodologies ● 1+ year of Javascript and/or Python programming ● Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or similar technical field, or 1+ years of equivalent experience
Job summary Prime Gaming is looking for a Quality Assurance Engineer to be the customer advocate and owner of the customer experience for our product. Prime Gaming is a leader in the games subscription business with benefits available to all Amazon Prime members geared at making Prime a no-brainer for game players. Games have the power to connect communities at a massive scale, and in this role, you’ll dive deep into the gaming community and help create new experiences and opportunities for connection. The ideal candidate will will be able to understand software code, be able to debug problems, automate repetitive tasks with scripting or automation tools, own all aspects of project testing, advocate for quality process improvements, and enjoy working with data, developers, and gamers. The candidate should also have experience with test plan creation, test case design, and have modern test automation skills. You will work closely with stakeholders in program management, production, business operations, account management, and engineering to ensure that Prime Gaming internal projects launch on time with a high quality bar. Here at Amazon, we embrace our differences and are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. Our team also puts a high value on work-live balance and offers flexible working hours. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. Additionally, our team is dedicated to supporting new members with mentorship and pathways for ongoing development. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and are building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and promotes career choice. If you have these traits and are excited about making a big impact in the game industry, building innovative solutions, and working with top-tier software engineers, we're looking for you! Key job responsibilities ● Create test plans, define test strategies, and create manual and automated test cases ● Use data to drive quality-based decisions and identify gaps within current testing processes ● Lead testing initiatives for a wide range of Prime Gaming projects ● Review feedback, investigate possible bugs, and work with different teams to resolve customer issues ● Exhibit a high attention to detail and proactive communication ● Contribute to a positive team environment and proactively help team members to meet and exceed team quality standards and goals ● Regularly report to stakeholders on the quality and reliability of our projects ● Familiarity with modern test automation frameworks (such as WebdriverIO or TestCafe) and test automation skills is a plus A day in the life This role will be focused on partnering with engineering teams to test new, innovative projects which will improve the Prime Gaming customer experience. The role is dynamic and flexible, providing opportunities to test a variety of technologies and implementations. If there is an opportunity to increase efficiency or learn a new skill, we always provide support to do so. We believe in data-driven decisions for testing, and we will always be focused on using data to identify what and how we should be testing. About the team The Engineering QA team is part of a new, centralized QA organization within Prime Gaming. We focus on helping each other grow our testing skill sets and providing support whenever someone needs help. As a team, we understand that learning and innovation are the backbone of a strong core, and we continuously push to raise the bar with our knowledge and support that we give.
Ability to operate within short live service release cycles.
Demonstrated use of data & analytics to identify testing gaps or issues.
Solid understanding of QA tool development chains and environments.
Familiarity with modern development tooling across front-end and back-end services (including React, GraphQL, REST, etc).
Creativity and initiative to improve product coverage and effectiveness.
Ability to understand functional and technical specifications and analyze data and output logs
Advanced coding skills
High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple competing priorities
simultaneously
Demonstrated building effective communication channels and working across multiple channels
Demonstrated ability to work with ambiguity

Content:
Zuma
3.9
Data Engineer
Remote

 About Zuma
Zuma makes an automated sales agent that converses with 100% of inbound leads, ultimately improving the way consumers interact with businesses and organizations. We've built this from the ground up using AI, ML, and human support which helps increase sales conversion and support capacity for businesses of all kinds. Zuma is one of the fastest-growing startups in Los Angeles, and is well-funded and backed by world-class investors such as Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), Y-Combinator, Joe Montana's fund (Liquid 2 Ventures), Day One Ventures, Soma Capital, and other notable angel investors including Austen Allred (from Lambda School), YC's former-COO Qasar Younis, among others.
Headquartered in Los Angeles, USA, we operate nationally and have plans to grow rapidly over the next few years. To do that, we need great people committed to our vision in a big way. We're looking to build a team of rockstars that are equally excited about the opportunity to leverage technology to improve the way customers interact with businesses!
Job Overview
We are looking for a savvy Data Engineer to join our growing team of analytics experts. The hire will be responsible for expanding and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross-functional teams. The ideal candidate is an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up. The Data Engineer will support our software developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects. They must be self-directed and comfortable supporting the data needs of multiple teams, systems and products. The right candidate will be excited by the prospect of optimizing or even re-designing our company's data architecture to support our next generation of products and data initiatives.
Responsibilities
Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture,
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and AWS ‘big data' technologies.
Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics.
Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
Keep our data separated and secure across national boundaries through multiple data centers and AWS regions.
Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader.
Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems.
Qualifications
Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.
Experience building and optimizing ‘big data' data pipelines, architectures and data sets.
Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.
Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.
A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets.
Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable ‘big data' data stores.
Strong project management and organizational skills.
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.
We are looking for a candidate with 5+ years of experience in a Data Engineer role, who has attained a Graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field. They should also have experience using the following software/tools:
Experience with big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.
Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including Postgres and Cassandra.
Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools: Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, etc.
Experience with AWS cloud services: EC2, EMR, RDS, Redshift
Experience with stream-processing systems: Storm, Spark-Streaming, etc.
Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc.

Content:
Zscaler
4.5
Data Engineer
San Jose, CA
$93K - $135K (Glassdoor est.)

 Company Description

Zscaler (NASDAQ: ZS) accelerates digital transformation so that customers can be more agile, efficient, resilient, and secure. The Zscaler Zero Trust Exchange is the company’s cloud-native platform that protects thousands of customers from cyberattacks and data loss by securely connecting users, devices, and applications in any location.
With more than 10 years of experience developing, operating, and scaling the cloud, Zscaler serves thousands of enterprise customers around the world, including 450 of the Forbes Global 2000 organizations. In addition to protecting customers from damaging threats, such as ransomware and data exfiltration, it helps them slash costs, reduce complexity, and improve the user experience by eliminating stacks of latency-creating gateway appliances.
Zscaler was founded in 2007 with a mission to make the cloud a safe place to do business and a more enjoyable experience for enterprise users. Zscaler’s purpose-built security platform puts a company’s defenses and controls where the connections occur—the internet—so that every connection is fast and secure, no matter how or where users connect or where their applications and workloads reside

Job Description

Position: Data Engineer
Location: Remote within United States
About the team: As part of the IT group, we are responsible for executing our enterprise data strategy which emphasizes data management maturity, fosters a robust data culture, and architects a best-in-class enterprise data platform. We have the ultimate goal to provide trusted data and insights at scale which enable corporate and functional data-driven decision making. We are fueled by organic innovation, internal collaboration and adoption of data visualization, data management, reporting automation, AI/ML and integration tools. We leverage best practices and alignment through our Enterprise Data Community to deliver speed to insight, scale, control and enablement. The team is distributed across the United States and India and is composed of data engineers, data analysts, visualization developers, and infrastructure specialists.
Responsibilities/What You’ll Do:
Collaborate with Data & Technical architects, integration and engineering teams to capture inbound/outbound data pipeline requirements, conceptualize and develop solutions
Support the evaluation and implementation of the current and future data applications/technologies to support the evolving Zscaler business needs
Collaborate with IT business engagement & applications engineer teams, enterprise data engineering and business data partner teams to identify data source requirements
Profile and quantify quality of data sources, develop tools to prepare data and build data pipelines for integrating into Zscaler’s data warehouse in Snowflake
Continuously optimize existing data integrations, data models and views while developing new features and capabilities to meet our business partners needs
Work with Principal Engineer/ Data Platform Lead to design and implement data management standards and best practices
Continue to learn and develop next generation technology/ data capabilities that enhance our data engineering solutions
Develop large scale and mission-critical data pipelines using modern cloud and big data architectures

Qualifications

Qualifications/Your Background:
3+ years of experience in data warehouse design & development
Strong experience in integrating internal and external business applications (salesforce, netsuite, google analytics etc) with cloud data platforms like Snowflake
Proficiency in SQL and ability to perform complex modeling with large volumes of data
Experience with Big Data technologies like Hadoop
Required Experience with any industry standard ETL & data integration platforms like Matillion, Workato, Dell Boomi
Experience with data orchestration to like Apache Airflow a plus
Experience with resolving workflow and data quality issues associated with production grade large scale cloud systems
Strong capacity to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Experience with Python, Dbt or similar a plus

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
#LI-YC2
#LI-Remote
What You Can Expect From Us:
An environment where you will be working on cutting edge technologies and architectures
A fun, passionate and collaborative workplace
Competitive salary and benefits, including equity
Why Zscaler?

People who excel at Zscaler are smart, motivated and share our values. Ask yourself: Do you want to team with the best talent in the industry? Do you want to work on disruptive technology? Do you thrive in a fluid work environment? Do you appreciate a company culture that enables individual and group success and celebrates achievement? If you said yes, we’d love to talk to you about joining our award-winning team.

Additional information about Zscaler (NASDAQ: ZS ) is available at https://www.zscaler.com.
Zscaler is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Content:
Faire
4.8
Wordpress Developer (Contract)
San Francisco, CA
$69K - $114K (Glassdoor est.)

 About Faire
Faire is an online wholesale marketplace built on the belief that the future is local — there are over 2 million independent retailers in North America and Europe doing more than $2 trillion in revenue. At Faire, we're using the power of tech, data, and machine learning to connect this thriving community of entrepreneurs across the globe. Picture your favorite boutique in town — we help them discover the best products from around the world to sell in their stores. With the right tools and insights, we believe that we can level the playing field so that small businesses everywhere can compete with these big box and e-commerce giants.
By supporting the growth of independent businesses, Faire is driving positive economic impact in local communities, globally. We're looking for smart, resourceful and passionate people to join us as we power the shop local movement. If you believe in community, come join ours.
About this role
The Faire marketing team is searching for a Wordpress developer (contract, part-time) to support our customer-facing blog, The Faire Learning Hub. The blog is a key part of Faire's long-term, multi-national customer acquisition strategy (localized blogs recently launched in the UK, Germany and France). More than 29,000 readers visit the blog each month, and audience size has nearly doubled year-over-year.
Reporting to Faire's Marketing Operations and Technology Lead, this developer will partner closely with staff content marketers, engineers and designers to scope, QA and ship improvements and optimizations. This work will help Faire:
Increase content consumption (e.g. time on page, visits per session, bounce rate)
Improve SEO
Drive retailer sign-ups and/or brand applications
Acquire new leads (e.g. gated experiences housed on the blog)
Level-up editorial quality (e.g. support new formats or multimedia)
Increase technical performance of blog (e.g. page load time)
About 10 hours per week needed
What you'll do
Collaborate with content marketing and marketing operations to scope and ship website requests
Implement new features and functionality based on provided designs and product requirements
Ensure high-performance and availability, and managing all technical aspects of the CMS
Identify opportunities to improve or replace existing plugins, optimize functionality and improve site performance
Research, recommend and source plugin solutions
Implement technical SEO updates as needed
Ongoing support and maintenance, including development, testing and debugging
Participate in monthly sprint-planning sessions
Qualifications
Complete understanding of the WordPress core software and its functions at the code level
Expert in security best practices
Ability to convert designs from Figma, etc into Wordpress elements and blocks
Experience in building WordPress themes/plugins
A self-starter with strong time-management capabilities
Proficiency in web design is a plus!

Faire's flexible work model aims to meet the needs of our diverse employee community by making work more flexible, connected, and inclusive. Depending on the role and needs of the team, Faire employees have the flexibility to choose how they work–whether that's mainly in the office, remotely, or a mix of both.
Roles that list only a country in the location are eligible for fully remote work in that country or in- office work at a Faire office in that country, provided employees are located in the registered country/province/state. Roles with only a city location are eligible for in-office or hybrid office work in that city. Our talent team will work with candidates to determine what locations and roles are eligible for each option.
Why you'll love working at Faire
We are entrepreneurs: Faire is being built for entrepreneurs, by entrepreneurs. We believe entrepreneurship is a calling and our mission is to empower entrepreneurs to chase their dreams. Every member of our team is an owner of the business and taking part in the founding process.
We are using technology and data to level the playing field: We are leveraging the power of product innovation and machine learning to connect brands and boutiques from all over the world, building a growing community of more than 350,000 small business owners.
We build products our customers love: Everything we do is ultimately in the service of helping our customers grow their business because our goal is to grow the pie - not steal a piece from it. Running a small business is hard work, but using Faire makes it easy.
We are curious and resourceful: Inquisitive by default, we explore every possibility, test every assumption, and develop creative solutions to the challenges at hand. We lead with curiosity and data in our decision making, and reason from a first principles mentality.
Faire was founded in 2017 by a team of early product and engineering leads from Square. We're backed by some of the top investors in retail and tech including: Y Combinator, Lightspeed Venture Partners, Forerunner Ventures, Khosla Ventures, Sequoia Capital, Founders Fund, and DST Global. We have headquarters in San Francisco and Kitchener-Waterloo, and a global employee presence across offices in Salt Lake City, Atlanta, Toronto, London, New York, LA, and Sao Paulo. To learn more about Faire and our customers, you can read more on our blog.
Faire provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression.
Faire is committed to providing access, equal opportunity and reasonable accommodation for individuals with disabilities in employment, its services, programs, and activities. To request reasonable accommodation, please fill out our Accommodation Request Form.

Visa
4.1
Data Engineer - Undergrad New College Grad - Multiple Locations - 2023
Palo Alto, CA
$101K - $150K (Glassdoor est.)

 Company Description

Visa is a world leader in digital payments, facilitating more than 215 billion payments transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses and economies to thrive.
When you join Visa, you join a culture of purpose and belonging – where your growth is priority, your identity is embraced, and the work you do matters. We believe that economies that include everyone everywhere, uplift everyone everywhere. Your work will have a direct impact on billions of people around the world – helping unlock financial access to enable the future of money movement.
Join Visa: A Network Working for Everyone.

Job Description

We are looking for new grad Data Engineer to join Visa’s growing team. Visa deals with billions of transactions daily. If you become part of our team, you will impact our clients’ lives by taking part in the designing and building of data processing systems and algorithms that give access to important but raw data.
As the data engineer, you are self-directed and comfortable supporting the needs of multiple teams, systems, and products through a wide variety of data sources using Big Data and Cloud technologies. You are excited by the prospect of optimizing or re-designing our company’s data architecture to support our next generation of products and data initiatives.
Responsibilities:
Design and deploy new applications directly in the Big Data and Cloud platform.
Identify the best practices for Big Data and Cloud service management & promote these across teams.
Migrate on-premises corporate applications and related data to the Big Data and the Cloud.
Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into clients’ critical business performance metrics using Big Data and Cloud service technologies.
Research, implement and maintain Big Data and Cloud services to support applications.
Create data tools for business team members that assist them in building and optimizing Visa’s products into innovative industry leaders.
Monitor data application performance for potential bottlenecks and resolve performance issues.
Identify and implement cost-saving strategies to reduce ongoing Big Data and Cloud costs/expenses.
Automate key services and tasks across Big Data and Cloud systems to increase efficiency
Formulating a recovery plan and executing the plan in the event of data pipeline downtime or failure

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications
Minimum of 6 months of work experience or a Bachelor's Degree
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, CIS/MIS, Cybersecurity, Business or a related field, graduating January 2022 - August 2023
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with programming languages such as JAVA, Scala, Python
Basic knowledge of distributed systems, and data structures
Experience with Big Data and the Cloud platform services: Apache Hadoop, Apache Spark.
Basic Knowledge in ETL, Data Pipelines using Python, Shell Scripts, Apache Airflow, and Apache Kafka; Building & Populating Data Warehouses, and Querying with BI tools.
Basic Knowledge in RDBMS fundamentals: Design & Creation of Databases, Schemas, Tables; DB Administration, Security & working with MySQL & IBM Db2.
Basic Knowledge in SQL query language, database functions, stored procs, working with multiple tables, joins, & transactions.
Basic Knowledge in NoSQL & Big Data concepts: MongoDB, Cassandra
Knowledge of best practices and IT operations in an always-up, always-available service
Experience with or knowledge of Agile Software Development methodologies
Strong communications skills, specifically, the absence of repeated grammatical or typographical errors, clear and concise written and spoken communications, and communications that demonstrate professional judgment.
The ability to take on challenges and address problems head-on
Strong ability to collaborate
Highly driven, resourceful and results oriented
Good team player and excellent interpersonal skills
Good analytical and problem-solving skills
Demonstrated ability to lead and navigate through ambiguity

Additional Information

Visa has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law.
Work Hours: Varies upon the needs of the department.
Travel Requirements: This position requires travel 5-10% of the time.
Mental/Physical Requirements: This position will be performed in an office setting. The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers.
Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.
Visa will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable local law, including the requirements of Article 49 of the San Francisco Police Code.

Toyota
3.9
Data Platform Engineer, Big Data
Plano, TX
$94K - $136K (Glassdoor est.)

 Who we’re looking for
Toyota’s Data and Analytics Department is looking for a passionate and highly motivated Data Ops Engineer, Toyota Big Data Platform.
The primary responsibility of this role is to identify and implement automations that reduce or eliminate manual work, reduce downtime, and provide self-service capabilities for Big data developers, data engineers, and analysts.
This is an Individual Contributor role that requires developing frameworks and cloud infrastructure solutions on the best-in-class enterprise Data Analytics Platform with cutting-edge technologies and guided by principles of Agility, DevSecOps, Infrastructure as a code, and continuous innovation.
Reporting to the Director of Big Data Solutions, the person in this role will support the Data and Analytics department's objective to enable data-driven decisioning as a core competency in our journey towards creating mobility for all.

What you’ll be doing
Develop innovative frameworks to automate data pipeline testing to meet the business expectation and improve the data quality.
Implement automation of infrastructure, security components, and Continuous Integration & Continuous delivery for optimal execution of data pipelines (ELT/ETL).
Develop solutions to build resiliency in data pipelines with platform health checks, monitoring, and alerting mechanisms, so quality, timeliness, recency, and accuracy of data delivery are improved.
Apply DevSecOps & Agile approaches to deliver the holistic and integrated solution in iterative increments.
Liaison and collaborate with enterprise security, digital engineering, and cloud operations to gain consensus on architecture solution frameworks.
Review system issues, incidents, and alerts to identify root causes and continuously implement features to improve platform performance.
Be current on the latest industry developments and technology trends to effectively lead and design new features/capabilities.
What you bring
Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, related discipline, or equivalent work experience.
Progressive years of hands-on experience developing DevOps pipelines involving version control, continuous integration servers, configuration management, deployment automation, infrastructure orchestration, monitoring, and analytics.
Progressive years of professional experience in data engineering and data management involving the development of ETL/ELT pipelines and programming in SQL, Python, Java, Scala-Spark, Bash, and other scripting languages.
Solid understanding of Big Data Cloud technologies such as AWS EMR, Apache Spark, Databricks, AWS Redshift, Snowflake, S3, GCP Big Query, Google Cloud Storage, and Google Data Proc.
Proficiency in cloud administration with experience developing infrastructure automation (Terraform, Cloud Formation) and provisioning Lambda, SNS, EC2, Airflow, Elastic Cache, Redis, RESTful APIs in AWS.
Experience in DevOps, data pipeline development, and automation using Jenkins, Ansible, Chef, XL Release, and XL Deploy.
Ability to research the latest trends and propose advanced tooling/solutions for data virtualization & digital twin concepts.
Excellent written, oral communication and presentation skills to present architecture, features, and solution recommendations to senior management.

Added bonus if you have
AWS/GCP cloud certifications.
AWS/GCP Data Engineering certifications.
DevOps certifications.
Experience with Automobile and/or Manufacturing organizations.
What we’ll bring
During your interview process, our team can fill you in on all the details of our industry-leading benefits and career development opportunities. A few highlights include:
A work environment built on teamwork, flexibility, and respect.
Professional growth and development programs to help advance your career, as well as tuition reimbursement.
Vehicle purchase & lease programs.
Comprehensive health care and wellness plans for your entire family.
Flextime and virtual work options (if applicable).
Toyota 401(k) Savings Plan featuring a company match, as well as an annual retirement contribution from Toyota regardless of whether you contribute.
Paid holidays and paid time off.
Referral services related to prenatal services, adoption, childcare, schools, and more.
Flexible spending accounts.
Relocation assistance (if applicable).
This position is based in Plano, TX . Toyota encourages all employees to live within a reasonable commuting distance of their assigned work location. Hybrid work from outside the assigned work location may be permitted in a pre-approved list of states with certain stipulations. Speak with your Recruiter and the Hiring Manager to learn more about our hybrid work program.
#LI-REMOTE
Belonging at Toyota
Our success begins and ends with our people. We embrace diverse perspectives and value unique human experiences. Respect for all is our North Star. Toyota is proud to have 10+ different Business Partnering Groups across 100 different North American chapter locations that support team members’ efforts to dream, do and grow without questioning that they belong. As a company that has been one of DiversityInc’s Top 50 Companies for Diversity and a member of The Billion Dollar Roundtable supporting minority and woman-owned suppliers for over 10 years, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer that celebrates the diversity of the communities where we live and do business.
Applicants for our positions are considered without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, religion, military or veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by law.
Have a question or need assistance with your application? Check out the How to Apply section of our_ _careers page on Toyota.com or send an email to TalentLinkAdmin@toyota.com.

Content:
42c Who are we ?

Content:
McKinsey & Company Who You'll Work With
Based in Paris and working across the region, as a consultant data engineer you will work closely with our clients, data scientists and all types of McKinsey consultants to curate problem specific datasets that feed directly into our machine learning and modeling approach.
This hybrid client-facing/technical role will allow you to use state of the art technologies to solve highly impactful business problems, whilst also leveraging your strong communication skills to convey complex intractable ideas to non-technical audiences.
who you are
This position is for a data engineer (all seniority levels) with strong intrinsic technical ability and an aptitude for solving complex problems using technology.
A core value at QuantumBlack is fusion and at the heart of our multi-disciplinary teams is the belief that the sum of individual parts will always be less than the impact of the entire team. You are a highly collaborative individual who is capable of laying aside your own agenda, listening to and learning from colleagues, challenging thoughtfully and prioritizing impact. You search for ways to improve things and work collaboratively with colleagues. You believe in iterative change, experimenting with new approaches, learning and improving to move forward quickly. Trust between colleagues is paramount here – you are an individual who can always be trusted to work in the best interests of all colleagues and to achieve the best outcome for QuantumBlack and our clients. You are naturally enthusiastic and enjoy sharing your passion with others.
What You'll Do
As a Data Engineer with the Paris office...
You will work in multi-disciplinary environments harnessing data to provide real-world impact for organizations globally. You will influence many of the recommendations our clients need to positively change their businesses and enhance performance.
See our video: A Day in the Life of a Data Engineer
Role responsibilities
Work with our clients to model their data landscape, obtain data extracts and define secure data exchange approaches
Acquire, ingest, and process data from multiple sources and systems into Big Data platforms
Understanding, assessing and mapping the data landscape.
Maintaining our Information Security standards on the engagement.
Collaborate with our data scientists to map data fields to hypotheses and curate, wrangle, and prepare data for use in their advanced analytical models.
Defining the technology stack to be provisioned by our infrastructure team.
Building modular pipeline to construct features and modeling tables.
Use new and creative techniques to deliver impact for our clients as well as internal R&D projects.
What you'll learn
No project is ever the same – we work across multiple sectors, providing unique learning and development opportunities across the region.
How successful projects on real world problems across a variety of industries are completed through referencing past deliveries of end to end pipelines.
Build products alongside the Core engineering team and evolve the engineering process to scale with data, handling complex problems and advanced client situations.
Be focused on the wrangling, clean-up and transformation of data by working alongside the Data Science team which focuses on modeling the data.
Using new technologies and problem-solving skills in a multicultural and creative environment.
You will work on the frameworks and libraries that our teams of Data Scientists and Data Engineers use to progress from data to impact. You will guide global companies through data science solutions to transform their businesses and enhance performance across industries including healthcare, automotive, energy and elite sport.
Real-World Impact – No project is ever the same; we work across multiple sectors, providing unique learning and development opportunities internationally.
Fusing Tech & Leadership – We work with the latest technologies and methodologies and offer first class learning programs at all levels.
Multidisciplinary Teamwork - Our teams include data scientists, engineers, project managers, UX and visual designers who work collaboratively to enhance performance.
Innovative Work Culture – Creativity, insight and passion come from being balanced. We cultivate a modern work environment through an emphasis on wellness, insightful talks and training sessions.
Striving for Diversity – With colleagues from over 40 nationalities, we recognize the benefits of working with people from all walks of life.
Our projects range from helping pharmaceutical companies bring lifesaving drugs to market quicker to optimizing a Formula1 car’s performance. At QuantumBlack you have the best of both worlds; all the benefits of being part of one of the leading management consultancies globally and the autonomy to thrive in a fast growth tech culture:
Healthcare Efficiency – We helped a healthcare provider improve their clinical trial practices by identifying congestion in diagn Data Engineer (full time, all seniority levels) - QuantumBla... 75008 Paris Work with our clients to model their data landscape, obtain data extracts and define secure data exchange approaches.
Fluency in both English and French.

Content:
Heaviside At Heaviside we partner with organizations to design data-augmented strategies, engineer pragmatic technologies and delivering impactful use-cases that enlighten real-world problem.
We step-function business by inventing their future way of working. We do this by designing data-augmented strategies, engineering pragmatic technologies and delivering impactful use-cases that enlighten real-world problems.
All roles at Heaviside involve business and technical development pathways which aim at facilitating your career growth. We aspire to build an employee experience where you will grow more with us, not be drowned out by the loudest voice, and hence we strive to set you up for a career which will have a greater impact.
As a Data Engineer at Heaviside, you will be joining a small team responsible for the data systems that power everything we do for our clients. It can cover both strategy and business planning as well as cutting-edge behavioral research and organizational analytics.
You will be responsible for the end-to-end implementation of the data stack from collection to reporting, with a focus on infrastructure and technical processes.
You will be working with Data Consultants and support them in tackling their clients' data challenges. You will contribute to the definition of data strategies, the implementation of data systems, and you will support the leverage of data into transformational projects.
In general, you will be responsible for understanding problems intimately, crafting a technical strategy to address them, and facilitating high-quality technical execution.
Responsibilities
Data Unifier: Architect, assemble, assimilate, clean, and conform large, complex datasets to deliver business insights and power data product experiences
Data Security Agent: Design and build reliable, scalable data infrastructure with leading privacy and security techniques to safeguard data
Data Ops: Own the end-to-end data stack including event collection, data governance, data integrations, and modeling
Data Custodian: Ensure consistency and quality of the technical environment and data structure through metrics, documentation, processes, data testing, and training
If you have some or all of the following please apply
Knowledgeable in Cloud Data Warehouse services. Experience in Google BigQuery, Snowflake, AWS Redshift/Athena, Looker, Azure SQL DWH or Azure Databricks is highly desirable
Knowledgeable in relational and big data architectures, data warehousing, data integration, data modeling, data optimization and data analysis techniques
Experience in building end to end data pipelines using on-premise or cloud-based data platforms
Experience with hands-on delivery of solutions which include databases, advanced SQL and software development in languages ​​such as Python
Interested and knowledgeable in Big Data technologies and Apache ecosystem technologies such as Beam, Spark, Kafka, Airflow, databases, integration, master data management, quality assurance, data wrangling and data governance technologies
Experienced with public cloud platforms and cloud infrastructure, which is essential
Exposed to ETL/ELT and governance tools
Interested in AI and ML technologies and principles
Able to migrate and transform large, complex datasets from various sources, structures and formats, modeled to support analysis for access to quality actionable insights
You are a strong analytical thinker and problem solver with thought leadership and commercial awareness
You are fully fluent in French and English (the position is based in Paris)
Benefits
At Heaviside, we are committed to living out our mission every day and that starts by providing benefits that allow our employees:
You will benefit from a competitive package based on your experience with opportunity for advancement
We are committed to make you grow and become the best version of yourself as part of a world-class team with bright and passionate people. Heaviside will strongly invest in your development through on-going training and personalized skills development path
We value initiative and are always happy to grant team building activities or any kind of insightful training
There is no subject matter expert at Heaviside, even if our consultants start their track with a strategic/business or tech “color”, they are expected to build or strengthen their expertise or consulting approach during client assignments
Our HR and Staffing team is closely following each individual in order to make everyone the best version of himself
Inclusion & Diversity
The diversity of our people is core to our ability to innovate, grow and to fulfill our collective aspiration of helping people to own their tomorrow. A natural curiosity, a respect for differences and a growth mindset are valued at Heaviside. Data Engineer Paris (75) Knowledgeable in relational and big data architectures, data warehousing, data integration, data modeling, data optimization and data analysis techniques.

Content:

Numberly puts technology to work for marketing: we help our clients better understand their consumers by implementing systems to collect, analyze and use data. For this, we are more than 150 engineers (a third of Numberly) divided into autonomous teams.
We want everyone to be able to develop a positive influence, be proactive, and question our technical or organizational choices.

Numberly is Gender Equal by design (women/men equality index of 97/100 in 2020, WeConnect International certification).

Possibility of being remote up to 50% of your time (to be organized as you wish).
Swile card (meal vouchers).

Content:
Carrefour The use of data and the development of analytical capabilities are a major focus of the Group's strategic plan for 2027. Directly attached to COMEX France, Carrefour France's Analytics Factory is the pillar of this analytical transformation, serving the All of Carrefour France's business teams – Marketing, Merchandise, Operations, E-commerce, Supply Chain, Financial Services, etc.

The management's data scientists, data engineers, data viz and data governance specialists support the business teams on a daily basis to improve operational excellence (process automation, democratization of access to data, development of the analytical culture), to optimize the offer and the customer experience on our sites and in our stores (assortments, promotion, personalization, forecasts, ...) and to help with strategic planning and decision-making.
Carrefour is looking for its Data & Analytics France Department based in Massy (91), a
Data engineer (M/F)

About the position
We use machine learning approaches to solve commercial and operational challenges such as in-store shortages, sales forecasting, optimization of product assortment, personalization of the experience on the carrefour.fr site
As a data engineer, you will build robust and scalable data processing systems to industrialize our machine learning solutions.
You will be attentive to the choice of the right tools and architectural diagrams in order to improve the performance of the systems and to facilitate their monitoring and maintenance.
As a member of our agile community of engineers, you will iteratively contribute to projects and conduct code reviews. You will also describe the infrastructure of our systems in code form.
Within feature teams, you will work daily with Data Scientists, Data Translators and Data Analysts. You will also interact with different Carrefour teams, in particular to integrate new data sources, to connect our solutions to different information systems, or to give them access to new data created by the lab.
Thanks to your incremental knowledge of Carrefour data, you will play a key role in the success of the Lab. Your expertise will also be essential at each stage of the projects: qualification, MVP, continuous integration, monitoring of the solution in production.
As a Data Engineer, you will report to the tech lead of the data science division, and will be guided by a Lead Data Scientist within your feature team.
About you
You have a degree in computer science at least at master's level, or you have equivalent professional experience.
After at least 2 years of professional experience as a Data Engineer, you have developed expertise in:
data manipulation with scripts (SQL) and code (Python)
the construction and operation of data pipelines on cloud infrastructures
the use of distributed computing frameworks
You enjoy exploring new datasets, transforming them, cleaning them and enriching them in order to make them usable.
You have taken part in collaborative development projects, and the quality and simplicity of the code are important to you.
You enjoy working with colleagues from different backgrounds, and it is pleasant to work with you on a day-to-day basis!
Thanks to excellent interpersonal and communication skills, you are able to communicate your complex ideas to various non-technical audiences.
You have a fluent command of French, and a minimum of technical English.

The little extras
We appreciate any experience building apps on GCP.
Your DevOps knowledge and experience (CI/CD process, containerization, ...) will also be valuable to us.
Machine learning being at the heart of our lab's mission, your knowledge and curiosity on this subject will be welcome!


CDI position based in Massy. Status frame Data Engineer H/F 91300 Massy As a data engineer, you will build robust and scalable data processing systems to industrialize our machine learning solutions.

Content:
SESAMm Who are we ?
SESAMm is the French leader in alternative data and Artificial Intelligence solutions applied to asset management (www.sesamm.com).
We are specialized in the creation of innovative analytics and alternative data: we analyze in real time billions of messages, articles and posts from several million data sources.
Team: more than 70 people, mainly engineers and researchers
Offices: Paris, New York, Tokyo, London, Tunis & Metz
International clientele made up of large accounts, including asset managers, hedge funds and major banks in North America, Asia and Europe.
Key technologies: Natural Language Processing, Big Data, Machine Learning and Quantitative Analysis
Join SESAMm, an innovative and fast-growing Fintech!
Why are we looking for a Data Engineer today?
Are you looking for a new challenge?
Do you dream of supporting a growing company, proposing new ideas, implementing new tools and developing processes?
At SESAMm, everyone brings their creativity, ideas and skills, we are all experts and beginners at the same time. We promote proximity, mutual aid and teamwork.
We learn every day from the experience of this great team and we are constantly taking on new challenges. We are proud of the work accomplished and of participating in the success of this great adventure!
In short: As a Data Engineer, you will be called upon to participate in the daily life of the team as well as to accompany us throughout our various projects.
Your daily life:
Participation in the conceptualization and implementation of a new product
Development and maintenance of Big Data calculation algorithms with the rest of the team
Production of datasets on various types of indicators (ESG, Quant, NLP)


Main technologies requested: PySpark/Hadoop, AWS, Docker
A good level of English, very good interpersonal skills and strong motivation are required. The candidate must be able to demonstrate autonomy and curiosity in the face of a constantly changing environment.
The list of missions described is not necessarily exhaustive and is likely to be modified according to the constraints of the company and the evolution of its needs.
What do we expect from you?
Your training:
You hold a diploma from level BAC +2 to level BAC +5 (BTS at engineering school) with a specialization in computer science, software engineering or Data Science. We accept any type of profile, as long as you have significant experience in IT.
Your background:
You have at least 5 years of experience in Data Engineering;
You have a good understanding of different databases and data storage technologies;
You have solid knowledge of calculation distribution systems, such as Dask or PySpark;
You have a good knowledge of cloud computing systems, such as AWS or GCP;
You have a good command of Python;
You are fluent in English and French.
Even better :
You have knowledge of Machine Learning libraries;
You have a strong interest in Data Science and NLP;
You are autonomous, thoughtful, and you know how to be critical;
You have good communication skills and you know how to be honest.
What we offer at SESAMm
Package: We offer attractive packages and various advantages: restaurant voucher card, company mutual insurance.
Flexibility: We have signed a telework charter which will eventually allow us to telework up to three days a week and more with the COVID context.
Work environment: In our premises the watchword is conviviality, you will find something to regain your strength (coffee, tea, drinks, snacks) and to have exchanges in a rich and multicultural environment.
Career: Deciding to join SESAMm means having prospects for development, seeing the real impact of your daily work and contributing to the development of a hyper-growth start-up.
Professional development: We consider training to be a key point, both internally with our Learn & Show (workshops led by colleagues for knowledge sharing) or externally via organizations or platforms.
Transparency: You will always be aware of the evolution of the company, transparency is essential and regular information meetings: "Ask Me Anything" once a month (information meeting), strategic meetings...
Well-being: We have placed well-being at work and a corporate culture with strong values ​​at the heart of our concerns.
In summary, SESAMm is a strong team spirit, communication facilitated by a horizontal hierarchy and a culture rich in diversity.
Working conditions
Location: Paris
Type of contract: CDI
Working conditions Data Engineer (H/F) Télétravail in Paris (75) Development and maintenance of Big Data calculation algorithms with the rest of the team.
Production of datasets on various types of indicators (ESG, Quant, NLP)…

Your role and your missions
As part of its work-study campaign, AXA is recruiting a Data engineer (M/F) in work-study.
'The objective of this position is to examine in 2022 the files for the migration of data from "legacy" data warehouses (infocentre, DWH) to our technological target which is the Data Lake. Achieving this objective requires work on several aspects:
Mapping of the existing on these "legacy" warehouses.
Understanding the needs of business teams.
Understanding of the current uses of business teams.
Ability to project an optimal data model in a distributed architecture environment.

JOB: Engineering
JOB TYPE: Full Time
JOB LEVEL: Vice President
DESCRIPTION
About Morgan Stanley
Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. The Firm's employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments, and individuals from more than 1,200 offices in 43 countries.

As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values ​​rooted in integrity, excellence, and strong team ethics. Morgan Stanley can provide a superior foundation for building a professional career – a place for people to learn, to achieve and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles, perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture.

Risk and Data Analytics Center, Paris
As we see increasing client interest in quantitative strategies, maintaining, and enhancing our leading position in risk analytics and technology is critical to our Institutional Securities Group (ISG) businesses globally. The seamless collaboration between technologists and ISG personnel, including data scientists, financial engineers and quantitative analysts helps to deliver innovative tools and solutions that differentiate us from our competitors.
Morgan Stanley is establishing a new Risk & Data Analytics (“R&D”) Center in Paris, where it will support our growth strategy for ISG both in EMEA and more broadly. The Center will deliver cutting-edge, proprietary solutions to address the rapidly changing business needs of our sales and trading franchise while providing a platform to foster innovation for our markets businesses, driven by analytical and technological excellence.

Technology at Morgan Stanley
Technology is the key differentiator that ensures that we manage our global businesses and serve clients on a market-leading platform that is resilient, safe, efficient, smart, fast and flexible. Technology redefines how we do business in global, complex and dynamic financial markets. We have a large number of award winning technology platforms that help to propel our Firm's businesses to be the top in the market. We have built strong techno-functional teams which partner with our offices globally taking global ownership of systems and products. We have a vibrant and diverse mix of technologists working on different technologies and functional domains. There is a broad focus on innovation, inclusion, giving back to the community and sharing knowledge.

What will you be doing?
A Data Analytics and Platform team within the Institutional Securities Technology division is seeking a collaborative, hands-on developer to build best-in-class solutions for Data APIs, Data Governance, Data Quality, Security & Privacy, and Architecture. This role offers a unique opportunity to work in a state-of-the-art modern data stack using open-source technologies aligned with our cloud strategy. We are looking for a proficient developer who is excited about innovation, with a proven track record of delivery.
Roles and responsibilities include:
You will work closely with quants and traders on multiple trading desks to design, develop, deploy and support the innovative data science environment
Design widely used and flexible APIs to our core data and functionality
Analyze and optimize performance of large data workloads using compute clusters
Stay up to date with emerging trends and tools in the data & analytics domain
Provide support and design advice to users of the cross-asset platform
Work closely with strategists and other stakeholders to help move their financial assets, valuation models and data pipelines to the platform
Efficient Communication across regions and functions
QUALIFICATIONS
What we're looking for:
We have a number of roles available for a range of technologists at different experience levels to join the team who will need;
Excellent problem solving and code development skills
Ability and interest to research, learn and implement new Data and Analytics technologies and paradigms
Enterprise level software development practices
Strong oral and written communication skills
Strong team working ability in local and global teams
Passion for continuous improvement both personally and as a team

Skills that will help you in the role:
Experience with at least one of the following technologies: Python and/or Java
Experience with performance optimization and concurrent programming
Exposure to Flask/Numpy/pandas/Plotly/Jupyter/Airflow and general data science stack experience
Exposure to Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning and other advanced methods of Data Management
Exposure to grid distributed applications
Exposure to KDB or other timeseries database technologies

Are you a job seeker and keenly interested in Data jobs? Are you passionate about developing solutions for processing large volumes of data? Do you like discovering new tools, collaborating and building skills on the cloud?

Content:
Safran Job Description
The democratization of the use of data in the aeronautical industry brings new problems in two main areas: production (Manufacturing data) and the operation of aircraft (Flight data). Whether it is the reduction of production costs for the first area or predictive maintenance for the second, projects using data science techniques are increasingly common and represent increasingly important issues.

In this context and within the Data division of Safran Engineering Services, your mission will consist in working jointly with Data Scientists, developers but also the business to deploy data pipelines comprising different processing bricks: ETL, Storage, algorithmic processing, visualization.

The projects in which you will take part will range from Proof Of Concept (POC) to the industrial solution through prototypes.
Job requirements
Scientific training: computer science, software development, mathematics / statistics, algorithms, physics,
Interest and motivation for industrial applications,
One or more experiences in an industrial field

You have the following skills:
Data architecture (Data modeling)
Design of the infrastructure / system architecture
Design and development of applications (software architecture)
Extraction, Transformation, Loading (ETL) of databases
Pipeline management
Testing
Data management (SQL and NoSQL)
Data security management
Algorithms, Coding
Software development
Statistics
Data Visualization - Exploration
Business knowledge and its industrial environment
Agile methodology and Cycle V

Your soft skills:
Motivated, autonomous, rigorous,
Adaptability, Curiosity
Strength of proposal, taking initiatives,
Analytical mind
Good communication skills,
Good communication,
Sense of customer service

Industrial experience in the field of transport and knowledge of Cloud architectures (public or private) would be a plus
Specificity of work
Occasional trips to France.

Safran is an international high-tech group operating in the fields of aeronautics (propulsion, equipment and interiors), space and defence. Its mission: to contribute sustainably to a safer world, where air transport is becoming ever more environmentally friendly, more comfortable and more accessible. Established on all continents, the Group employs 79,000 people for a turnover of 16.5 billion euros in 2020, and occupies, alone or in partnership, leading global or European positions in its markets. Safran engages in research and development programs that maintain the environmental priorities of its technological innovation roadmap.

Safran is ranked best global employer 2020 in its sector by Forbes magazine.

Safran Engineering Services offers high-tech engineering services in the fields of aeronautics, energy and ground transportation. With 30 years of experience, the company relies on 3,000 engineers in 9 countries around the world.

BAC+5
More than 3 years Data Engineer F/H Magny-les-Hameaux (78)

Content:
iQera French leader in debt management and acquisition, iQera supports large companies and financial institutions at every stage of their financial client relationship by combining a culture of operational excellence, artificial & human intelligence.
iQera aspires to make a difference through these beliefs:
- Achieve the unprecedented
- Play Collective
- Leave a positive imprint
More than CVs, iQera seeks above all personalities who make the difference. The company wants to build a community of committed and atypical employees who are curious to learn, want to find their way, flourish and give meaning to their job.
The Group currently relies on a tribe of more than 2,300 employees spread over 13 sites in 6 countries.
Your missions within our tribe
Within the "Data Management" department of the Delivery & Technology department, you act as a Data Engineer with the aim of supplying, developing and documenting the implementation of our corporate Data Lake.
In particular, you will be responsible for:
Collect the data that will feed the Data Lake
Coordinate impacts and planning with data source applications
Develop, publish, and schedule data feeds
Manage the infrastructure and architecture of the Data Lake in conjunction with the management's infrastructure teams

Keep the Data Lake running smoothly

(in particular performance (Data Scientist), Commerce and Operations), internal control, the DPO and of course with the Data Quality and Data Analysts teams.

Holder of a higher education in computer science, you justify a minimum of 5 years' experience as a Data Engineer and have a strong autonomy.
You have a very good knowledge of the Microsoft Azure cloud environment and have an excellent command of Python, the Spark framework, SQL and database management tools. Very good knowledge of Databricks and Data Factory would be a strong plus for the position.
Recognized for your analytical and synthesis skills, you have an excellent ability to solve business problems. You are curious, rigorous and pragmatic, endowed with an ease to work in a transverse way beyond your team. You are keen to work in a growing group and participate in its development.

Content:
McKinsey & Company Who You'll Work With
Based in Paris and working across the region, as a consultant data scientist you will work closely with our clients, data engineers and all types of McKinsey consultants on interdisciplinary projects, using maths, stats and machine learning to derive structure and knowledge from raw data across various industry sectors.
This hybrid client-facing/technical role will allow you to use state of the art technologies to solve highly impactful business problems, whilst also leveraging your strong communication skills to convey complex intractable ideas to non-technical audiences.
who you are
This full time position is for a data scientist across all seniority levels with strong intrinsic technical ability and an aptitude for solving complex problems using technology.
A core value at QuantumBlack is fusion and at the heart of our multi-disciplinary teams is the belief that the sum of individual parts will always be less than the impact of the entire team. You are a highly collaborative individual who is capable of laying aside your own agenda, listening to and learning from colleagues, challenging thoughtfully and prioritizing impact. You search for ways to improve things and work collaboratively with colleagues. You believe in iterative change, experimenting with new approaches, learning and improving to move forward quickly. Trust between colleagues is paramount here – you are an individual who can always be trusted to work in the best interests of all colleagues and to achieve the best outcome for QuantumBlack and our clients. You are naturally enthusiastic and enjoy sharing your passion with others.
What You'll Do
As a Data Scientist with the Paris office...
You will work in multi-disciplinary environments harnessing data to provide real-world impact for organizations globally.
You will influence many of the recommendations our clients need to positively change their businesses and enhance performance.
Role responsibilities
Work on complex and extremely varied data sets from some of the world’s largest organizations to solve real world problems
Develop data science products and solutions for clients as well as for our data science team
Write highly optimized code to advance our internal Data Science Toolbox
Work in a multi-disciplinary environment with specialists in machine learning, engineering and design
Add real-world impact to your academic expertise, as you are encouraged to write ‘black’ papers and present at meetings and conferences should you wish
Attend conferences such as NIPS and ICML as one global team as well as Data Science retrospectives where you will have the opportunity to share and learn from your co-workers.
Work within one of the largest and most advanced data science teams in Europe, support the Lead Data Scientists to develop data science products
What you'll learn
How successful projections on real world problems across a variety of industries are completed through referencing past deliveries of end to end machine learning pipelines
Build products alongside the core engineering team and evolve the engineering process to scale with data, handling complex problems and advanced client situations
Be able to focus on modeling by working alongside the Data Engineering team which focuses on the wrangling, clean-up and transformation of data.
Best practices in software development and productionise machine learning by working with our Machine Learning Engineering teams which optimizes code for model development and scale it
Work with our UX and Visual Design teams to interpret your complex models into stunning and user-focused visualizations
Using new technologies and problem-solving skills in a multicultural and creative environment
You will work on the frameworks and libraries that our teams of Data Scientists and Data Engineers use to progress from data to impact. You will guide global companies through data science solutions to transform their businesses and enhance performance across industries including healthcare, automotive, energy and elite sport.
Real-World Impact – No project is ever the same; we work across multiple sectors, providing unique learning and development opportunities internationally.
Fusing Tech & Leadership – We work with the latest technologies and methodologies and offer first class learning programs at all levels.
Multidisciplinary Teamwork - Our teams include data scientists, engineers, project managers, UX and visual designers who work collaboratively to enhance performance.
Innovative Work Culture – Creativity, insight and passion come from being balanced. We cultivate a modern work environment through an emphasis on wellness, insightful talks and training sessions.
Striving for Diversity – With colleagues from over 40 nationalities, we recognize the benefits of working with people from all walks of life.

Content:
Gefco Chronotruck is a tech company that wants to transform the road transport of goods using algorithms and Data! In a nutshell: a web and mobile B2B platform for connecting shippers and geolocated professional carriers, which facilitates transactions between the two parties.

A pioneer in its field (even before the US!), Chronotruck is one of the French leaders in road freight 2.0. Acquired in 2019 by the transport giant GEFCO (https://www.gefco.net/fr/), the ambition from 2020 to 2022 is to become the European and then world leader in road freight transport.

Chronotruck has been selected as one of the 20 global companies that will revolutionize the road freight industry by Frost & Sullivan.
On the tech side, the team is made up of about ten people who work together to offer our users the best possible experience.

Our values: autonomy, involvement, rigour, desire to progress.

As part of a job creation, we are recruiting a:

Data Engineer / Machine learning engineer – M/F
Position based in Paris 9th

Assignment
On the tech side, the team is made up of around ten people who work together to offer our users the best possible experience; our values: autonomy, involvement, rigour, desire to progress.

Within the tech team (10 people), you will come to strengthen the data team (3 people with you) in particular on data engineering subjects but also on data science and data analysis. You will report to the head of data. Your missions for this position are as follows (non-exhaustive list):

You are THE (THE) technical manager of the stack data, you are free to choose
You take care of the deployment and maintenance of production pipelines
You participate in the development of new data science algorithms by bringing in particular your technical fluency
You grow the team on data engineering topics
You do technology watch on data engineering and data science

Profile
Ideally you already have a first experience as a machine learning engineer, or as a data engineer

You master Python, SQL, Docker and Git. If you know Airflow, that's a plus!
You know the basics of machine learning, if you know more than the basics, it's even better!
You have already implemented ML algorithms in real contexts

### Soft skills

You care about the user experience, you hate seeing a bug in production
You are data-driven and business-oriented
You have an eye for detail, but you also know how to be pragmatic
Are you ready to take an interest in the freight transport sector?

### Why join us

You will be part of a small data team composed today of 2 data scientists, passionate, dynamic, talented and involved
You will benefit from a great autonomy and your initiatives will be encouraged
You will participate in strategic technical decisions
You will work on rich and transport-specific data as well as on original algorithms

If you want to know more, we have a developer site: https://developers.chronotruck.com/
Our Welcome to the Jungle page: https://www.welcometothejungle.com/fr/companies/chronotruck

In accordance with the commitments made by GEFCO in favor of the integration of people with disabilities, this position is open to all. Data Engineer / Machine learning engineer – H/F Paris (75) Ideally you already have a first experience as a machine learning engineer, or as a data engineer.
You will report to the head of data.

Content:
Cartier Reference code: 67364
CDI - Data Engineer (M/F)
PARIS, 75, FR
Permanent
The history of Cartier is based on audacity and passion. We have adopted a pioneering and daring spirit that has continued to inspire our teams, across all businesses, from our boutiques to our workshops and our head offices for more than 170 years. We have more than 8,500 employees of 90 different nationalities who share an independent spirit and a commitment to excellence, and who aim to constantly enrich the house's heritage by pushing the limits of creativity.

World number 1 in jewelery and number 2 in prestige watchmaking, Cartier has combined know-how and excellence since 1847.
Much more than a simple company, the House has made its creations true legends, thanks to men and women who make their passion their profession.

Within the Industrial Strategy Department, attached to the Business Intelligence Manager, you will be the referent for the implementation of data flows and the management of our datawarehouse. You will participate in the transition of our ecosystem to the cloud.

Build and maintain data streams

Content:
SANCARE Sancare offers predictive tools using the latest advances in artificial intelligence to put this data at the service of health professions.
The Sancare team is made up of around thirty people specialized in IT development, machine learning and health. We are also fortunate to be accompanied by recognized researchers in the field of machine learning, as well as by doctors and experts from the world of health.
Being at Sancare means above all being a benevolent team, which helps each other and is constantly striving to progress. We are a close-knit team, with strong and shared values:
Persevere by helping each other
Stay close to customer needs
Combine rigor and pragmatism
Grow and make others grow
Collaborate with transparency and respect.
We are looking for a Data Engineer with solid operational skills and wishing to join a dynamic, experienced and motivated team, in order to accelerate the arrival of our breakthrough solutions in the world of health.
Data management and processing are at the heart of Sancare's issues. As each hospital has its own information system, connectors must be implemented for each, in order to feed the machine learning algorithms. The means of access and the format of the data contained in the patient files are very varied and differ from one establishment to another.
In addition, many measures must be respected in order to guarantee the security and confidentiality of data.
Duties:
Development of connectors allowing the transmission of hospital data between hospital IS and Sancare software
Development of tools for standardizing and processing hospital data for use by machine learning algorithms
Improvement and maintenance of existing data processing functionalities
Operational management of the various data processing services

Content:
Allianz France Description of the mission

Allianz France, since 2016, has been developing capabilities in the field of Big Data and AI. This resulted in the creation of a dedicated department in 2018, bringing together employees of various profiles: Data Scientists, Data Analysts, Data Engineers, Data Product Owners, Dev Web and more recently Data Science Product Leader.


The Big Data & AI Factory team is one of the 4 teams in this direction. This team has 4 agile scrums for a total of around 40 people and its areas of responsibility include:


Ensure the implementation of Data projects from the opportunity study (POC, POV) to production and follow-up in run
Implementation of AI projects with strong business impacts: predictive models, Computer Vision, NLP, Scoring, etc.
Assist the company's operational processes with AI and Big Data tools (5M acts assisted by AI in 2020)
Democratize access to Data (api & apps)
Fraud detection, analysis of emails, images, triggers, voice bots, etc.

The team is well established and now has such experience that it can manage a dozen projects in production while regularly delivering new ones!


Key Responsibilities

Within the Big Data & AI Factory team, under the responsibility of the Head of Data Science, you will have the role of Data Scientist (M/F).


As such, you will have the following responsibilities:


Ensure a role of expertise on the projects and data of the team by having a transverse vision to all the scrums;
Carry out data or Machine Learning studies to analyze new opportunities or respond to business requests by interacting directly with the business teams;
Lay the foundations for new projects (POC, POV);
Participate in the industrialization of projects or the improvement of existing projects;
Ensure a technological watch to offer ever more efficient tools and methods;
Support the skills development of other Data Scientists.


Profile / Skills

Let's talk about you:


Coming from a higher education in a related field (engineering, statistics, mathematics) and comfortable with statistical tools
5+ years of experience in the field of Data Science or Big Data
Work experiences in agile mode
Successful experiences in a similar field, particularly with a data project industrialization context
Expertise with data analysis and Big Data tools, including:

Languages: Python, pyspark, SQL
Databases: PostgreSQL, elasticsearch
Code management: Git, Gitlab, CI/CD
Job and pipeline management: Luigi (or equivalent)
Logs: prometheus, graphana

A business-oriented mindset and contribution of value for the business teams;
Rigorous to ensure a quality of deliverables and didactic to present the subjects to the trades
Professional use of English


The little extras:
A good knowledge of the insurance business


If you recognize yourself through this announcement, then do not hesitate to apply, we are waiting for you!


Further information
CDI position based at the Tour Franklin - Paris, La Défense.

The Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring about our employees, their ambitions, their dreams and their challenges is what makes us a unique employer. Together, we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, grow, and shape a better future for our customers and the world around us. We are delighted to have you among us. Let's care for tomorrow! Join an international Group strongly rooted in the territories
Your destination
Our Management defines the Group's Transformation Strategy and monitors its implementation through 9 strategic programs.
Among these programs, our team within the Digital department runs the "Data Powered" program, which aims to increase the Data maturity of the Group and its Countries and to enhance its Data assets that are still underused around an innovative methodology focused on value. use cases for well-defined profiles.
Within the “Data Powered” strategic program team, we set up a certain number of technical environments that need to be governed and we carry out data manipulation developments for the specific needs of the Group/Corporate.
