Content:
Ornikar About the Data team

The Data team at Ornikar has existed for more than 3 years and is made up of a dozen people (Data Analysts, Data Engineers, Machine Learning Engineers).
We have mainly 3 missions:
Decision support: we support teams at all levels of management, whether for strategic objectives, product development, business, etc. We conduct complex analyzes to enable teams to make decisions based on figures that will enable us to achieve our objectives or identify new levers for growth.
Operational efficiency: The teams at Ornikar are very sensitive to data issues, which has enabled us to set up BI self-service on the one hand to allow them to carry out their quantitative research in complete autonomy, and to on the other hand, we respond to data flow automation issues to enrich their tools and speed up their daily lives.
The development of data features and algorithms to bring even more differentiating value to our products.
We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer
In a process of long-term reflection on our products, we want to tackle our future competitive challenges now and seek differentiation through data, with the ambition of rising to the standards of insurTech and comparable scale-ups. in terms of innovation and best practices. Furthermore, as the Data team grows, the Data Science challenges develop. We have made our first proofs on research projects as well as in algorithms, it is time to confirm the test!
In this context, we are looking for our next Machine Learning Engineer. We are looking for a confirmed profile to help with the data development of Ornikar, in particular:
Participate in the construction of the Data roadmap, in particular in terms of innovation and medium-long term differentiation by Data, to meet growth ambitions.
Collect, analyze and understand the business needs entrusted to us by the Insurance teams (Marketing & Sales, Customer Experience & Claims) on Data Science and Machine Learning issues.
Design, plan, support and deliver machine learning projects that meet expectations (OCR, prediction, segmentation, etc.), knowing how to balance the challenges of feasibility, speed and business imperatives
Train, optimize, validate and deploy machine learning models, ensure their relevance, and monitor them (drifts, availability, performance, etc.)
Carry out monitoring work in order to keep our algorithms at the state of the art.
Maintain the code base of data science projects and develop Data Science industrialization processes at Ornikar (feature-store, etc.).
Work with the Data Engineering and Data Science Pricing teams to maintain a scalable architecture
Our stack: Fivetran, Mixpanel, Airflow, GCP including BigQuery, dbt, Metabase, dvc, docker, git & gitlab, fastAPI
Also, as the team is still in development, we remain very open to initiatives (tech / tools / etc.)! Joining us is the guarantee of working in a stimulating environment, of having an impact in the structuring of the team and its processes and of participating in the growth of a great project.
You are our ideal candidate if you...
You have at least 3 years of conclusive experience as Machine Learning on a modern Data stack, with a big plus if you have worked on OCR and classification issues, and on regression and time series models
You have already put into production and maintained Machine Learning models on a Cloud infrastructure, and you are able to maintain their relevance and availability.
You are proficient in Python and SQL
You are curious, enthusiastic, resourceful and you have a proactive approach
You like working in a team and communicating with audiences that are not necessarily technical
The recruitment process for this position
A first telephone conversation with Cassie, our Talent Acquisition Specialist
Interview with your future manager Thibault, Head of Data Operations on the Insurance side, to clarify the outlines of the position and the challenges of the team
A case study to prepare at home, then to restore around a videophone exchange of 1 hour to project you on missions of the post in real conditions
A cultural interview with the current members of the team to give you an overview of our rituals, methods, and to embark on our vision!


What Ornikar has to offer you…
Fixed compensation between €48k and €65k, depending on your level of impact and expertise observed during our interviews
The possibility of working remotely from anywhere in France

We are your ideal company if you are looking for…
A French start-up that has become a scale-up that is structuring, developing Machine Learning Engineer - Insurance Télétravail in 75019 Paris 19e The development of data features and algorithms to bring even more differentiating value to our products.
The recruitment process for this position.

Content:
ORTEC Time to apply what you have learned – ORTEC Junior Data Engineer
For this year and beyond, our Data Science & Consulting division (ODSC) has very ambitious plans to further improve the world [of our customers] using mathematics, data science and advanced analytics. To realize those plans, we need you as a Data Engineer! Being part of our Team means that you will be part of a mathematical and technical playground, outperforming in the field of Data Science, Data Engineering, Operations Research and Analytics, where smart minds grow into multi-talents.
Who we are
At ORTEC we know how to create value out of data using a proven approach and the latest tools and technologies. Since 1981 we improve business decisions by leveraging data and providing decision support models for many industry leading companies. No big studies and reports, but tangible, scalable and sustainable results. Our people are data-driven at heart and are eager to turn their broad expertise into concrete value. Making an impact by leveraging value out of the data is what makes ORTEC the go-to-company.
We are experienced in areas such as: Operations Management, Supply Chain Management, Marketing & Customer Interaction, Innovation, Sustainability and Organizational Development in markets like Retail, Energy, Transport, Post and Parcel and Manufacturing. This has led to valued strategic partnerships with parties such as FedEx / TNT, AirFrance-KLM, Total Energies, Shell, Air Liquide and Carrefour.
You as our new team member
During your first months at ORTEC, you will be given responsibility early on. You will get the opportunity to acquire more knowledge, to develop your passions, and to find out what kind of projects suit your ambitions.
In close collaboration with the client's project leads, technical leads and engineers, the ORTEC Data Engineering team build the data ingestion and processing pipelines. This way, you support the business requirements for analysis, visualizations and advanced analytics modeling. As a Junior Data Engineer, you work on projects like designing and building robust and complex data infrastructures for data analytics and machine learning purposes in the cloud. Projects subjects range from Internet-of-Things in supply chain, forecasting apps for production and customer demand, to creating a centralized data environment for the management of a large manufacturing organization.
Fully involved in our French team, serving our European customers, you mostly work on projects, in close connection with the technical and business representatives of our customers to better understand their needs and how ORTEC can help solving their challenges. Your work includes design, architecture, data quality, development and delivery of the various data driven apps and associated functionalities (e.g. visualization, data catalog, training).
As part of an international team, you'll have the opportunity to really make impact in your market(s) and have the benefits of a multi-disciplinary team by learning from each other and joining social activities.
Our hands-on training will give you the skills required for the various roles you will play. In terms of building your soft-skills, we also provide courses to improve your communication skills, to teach you how to work on projects more efficiently, to improve your time management, and to enlarge your commercial skills.
Join the team
Our team in Paris consists of around 20 people. You are coached on the job and supported to develop yourself by experienced consultants.
At ORTEC you will work with highly motivated colleagues with a passion for software and mathematics. We operate in a flat organizational structure that keeps communication lines short. The atmosphere is open, informal, collaborative, and fun.
who you are
You have a Bachelor's or a Master's degree in Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Information Science or other relevant studies
You are ready for your first or second step in your career
Strong communicator, a self-starter and motivated by the clients’ vision, contact and interaction
Able to work in a team, both remote and at the location of the client
Experience in modeling and programming
Knowledge of SQL, R, Python, and/or data modeling is an advantage
Knowledge of data visualization tools as Spofire, Tableau or PowerBI is a plus
Ambitious and quick problem-solver
Able to fluently communicate in both French and English (verbally and in writing).
Are you our future Colleague? You can apply using the ‘Apply’ button below. If you have any questions you can contact us via Recrutement.France@ortec.com Junior Data Engineer Paris (75) In close collaboration with the client’s project leads, technical leads and engineers, the ORTEC Data Engineering team build the data ingestion and processing…

Content:
Ysance Company Description*
Who are we ?*
Ysance is a company specializing in data created in 2005. We are part of the Devoteam group, a major player in digital transformation.
We are organized into two very complementary communities: Tech for Data (engineering & architecture) and Data for Business (data science, viz, data analytics & business analytics). Our teams support companies to make data a business accelerator. This support covers both the issues of data management in "on premise" environments but also a strong know-how in the subjects of move to cloud; Ysance leveraging the capabilities of* Devoteam, cloud leader with benchmark partnerships on GCP, AWS, Azure, …*
As part of our development, we are strengthening our teams!
Why join us?
Being continuously trained: Ysance has developed a solid training & certification program (partnerships with Microsoft Power BI, , Tableau, Looker, Qlik, Dataiku, SAS, etc.), particularly on cloud* platforms (GCP, AWS, Azure,* …)
Intervene on varied and specialized subjects: Ysance intervenes in many sectors of activity (Retail, luxury, media, telecoms, banking, industry, etc.) for major international accounts
Join a specialized company: Ysance only deals with data The guarantee of intervention on specific subjects at the heart of your expertise
Joining a team: Ysance is above all a team on a human scale benefiting from* the ecosystem of a large group*
The Devoteam Group works for equal opportunities, for the promotion of its employees based on merit and actively fights against all forms of discrimination. We are convinced that diversity contributes to the creativity, dynamism and excellence of our organization. All our positions are open to people with disabilities
Job Description*
Who are you ?*
Coming from a higher education * Bac +5 * or more (engineering school, doctorate, master, specialized master), we are looking for collaborators with different levels of seniority such as Consultants, Senior Consultants, Lead Consultants, Project managers, …
Your daily life:
As a Data Engineer, you will be required to:
Support business teams in their work to identify and express data needs,
Design solutions requiring the use of Cloud & Data technologies to meet business use cases,
Develop and test data lake data ingestion and data processing flows,
Deploy, optimize and industrialize data pipelines in the Cloud on a daily basis,
Work collaboratively to support the development of new features.
Your technical skills
You have Cloud-related knowledge
You have advanced skills around SQL, Python or Scala languages,
You are familiar with the Spark Framework,
You have a good command of deployment optimization (Docker, Serverless, etc.),
You have knowledge of industrialization processes (Terraform) and orchestration tools
Ideally, you have already deployed in the Public Cloud (AWS, GCP, AZURE).
Qualifications
You are a Data Engineer and have carried out deployment projects within the Public Cloud. You like to actively share around technological watch, you wish to transmit your knowledge during internal or external technical training sessions, but also to continue to progress by sharing with international data experts around technical workshops and by intervening around topics of expertise, then join us!
Location: 73 Rue Anatole France, 92300 Levallois-Perret
Job type: Full time Data Engineer 92300 Levallois-Perret We are organized into two very complementary communities: Tech for Data (engineering & architecture) and Data for Business (data science, viz, data…

Join our Team of experts in data/AI applied to the energy transition (more than 30 use cases!).
MP DATA is a team of 70 Data experts (Data Scientists, Data Engineers, Data Architects, ML Engineers) who support the largest French groups on ambitious and innovative AI projects.

As such, you will have the following responsibilities:

Content:
Valoway The company

Valoway, Pure Player Data, IA & Cloud, was born from an irrepressible desire to undertake, from the passion for new technologies and the idea, shared today by many, that the valuation of data and the adoption of cloud solutions is at the heart of the transformation of our society.
Present in Rennes, Niort, Paris and Nantes, we work from start-ups to large accounts on innovative projects, through the development and strategic implementation of digital transformations.

Driven by the desire to take up new challenges, we are convinced that the wealth of our expertise lies in the diversity of our team and the working environment that we build together.

Job Description

As part of our development, we are recruiting our future consultant or data engineer consultant in Paris, Ile de France. Agile in our organization, you are functionally attached to the project manager on whom you intervene, so your mission revolves around:
Recommend, implement and industrialize the most suitable and efficient solutions embedding the solutions of Google Cloud Providers, with our customers, thanks to a close relationship allowing active listening and feedback.
Program and produce an infrastructure capable of extracting, transforming and loading the data generated by our customers.
Ensure that the data pipelines deployed are sufficiently secure and clear to be analyzed by Data Analysts and then transformed by Data Scientists who will apply algorithms to them.
Lead and support a team of Data professionals, external or internal, on all stages of data processing and the adoption of methods, know-how and good development practices.
Carry out regular and shared monitoring of the state of the art of Data Management and the most efficient solutions on the market.
Participate in the design and implementation of the best technological and methodological solutions to serve our DATA and AI use cases.
Collaborate on cross-functional Valoway projects.
Our technical environment
Structured languages: Javascript, Scala, Python…
Cloud providers: Google Cloud Provider
Operating systems: UNIX, Linux, Solaris,
Database solutions: SQL, NoSQL…
Data storage and extraction tools: Data fusion
Big Data technologies for processing and manipulating data: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.
Working environment

Would you like to know more about the Data Engineer position at Valoway? Our team talks about it best: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=acMETXLTkUI
For this position of data consultant in CDI executive status, you work during the week on daytime hours and benefit from RTT.
Agility is at the heart of our organization, it is reflected in particular by a hybrid way of working and the possibility of alternating between being present with our customers, in our offices or working remotely, depending on the subjects to be carried out.
For this experienced Data Engineer position, the indicative salary that we offer in Paris is €49,000 gross per year - This remuneration is studied according to your profile.

Required profile

Beyond your training in computer programming and data management, type engineering school, and your technical expertise supported by at least 4 years' experience as a data engineer, Data Engeneer or Big Engineer Data on engineering and data integration projects, in particular on GCP or AZURE, ideally enhanced by certifications, this is also a state of mind that we are looking for.
Becoming a Consultant at Valoway means deciding to join an agile team whose desire is to innovate, develop its skills and take up new challenges together:
Collaborate with consultants with a high level of skills, supported by strategic missions and significant use cases in complex environments in the insurance, banking, industry, transport, retail or large distribution.
Choose a role that brings added value to our clients: our consultants have acquired strong expertise in understanding strategic issues and implementing cross-functional data enhancement projects for operational performance, business innovation and corporate customer excellence.
Be an actor in the internal life of Valoway, meet a team on a human scale, ambitious and driven by intrapreneurship; internal sharing times are at the heart of our organization and allow us to work on innovative subjects that fascinate us individually or collectively and thus co-construct the working environment that suits you (internal community animation, internal project groups Data Engineer GCP F/H 75007 Paris 7e For this position of data consultant in CDI executive status, you work during the week on daytime hours and benefit from RTT.

Content:
Talend WHO WE ARE:

Talend, a leader in data integration and data governance, is changing the way the world makes decisions. In order to compete and win, IT and business leaders need data that they can trust and understand instantly. Talend Data Fabric is the only platform that seamlessly combines an extensive range of data integration and governance capabilities to actively manage the health of corporate information. This unified approach is unique and essential to delivering complete, clean, and uncompromised data in real-time to all employees. It has made it possible to create innovations like the Talend Trust Score™, an industry-first assessment that instantly quantifies the reliability of any data set.
Over 7,250 customers have chosen Talend to run their businesses on healthy data. Talend is recognized as a leader in its field by leading analyst firms and industry media.
We pride ourselves in our values ​​of Passion, Agility, Team Spirit, and Integrity. Every one of our 1,400 employees brings a certain je ne sais quoi that makes Talend special.

We are looking for an engaged and enthusiastic Data Engineer to join our brand new Telemetry Platform Team!
We make the pattern “You build it, you run it” a reality for the Products teams and make them more autonomous, allowing them to create better products and solve customer problems faster.

Reasons why we enjoy our work:
We care about our fellow engineers at Talend who are our internal users but also, equally important, we care about Talend’s customers.

This is not only about what we do, but mostly why and how. We discuss business needs, plan and work out solutions collectively, as a team. We also measure and value our impact on the company.

We design, setup develop and operate a reliable and robust central telemetry data service to develop internal data-driven analytics and smart customer facing applications - combining the innovative Data Lakehouse and Data mesh data platform concepts.
Teamwork is key and we enjoy solving problems together in pairs or as a whole team in an Agile approach.
How you will make an impact:
Build the brand new Telemetry Platform: You'll build a strong data science platform that will allow Talend teams (Data Engineering, Professional services, Customer success, Sales, Marketing, Product managers…) have a better understanding of the Talend Data Cloud Platform usage from its customers, and Data Scientists team to develop ML based services for the Talend Data Fabric.

Deliver best-in-class solutions: Work with top notch data technologies for Data ingestion, Data batch and streaming processing.Data governance, Data advanced analytics and ML solutions. Collaborate with Data Scientist/analysts to develop and deploy ML models and services and deliver relevant insights and dashboards

Be a team player: Support the data scientist and the business in delivering seamlessly solutions that will help to have a better understanding of our Cloud platform usage. Promote new technologies, methods and raise awareness around new technologies and innovations
We're looking for a teammate who is a:
Creative solution builder and passionate about Data Engineering! That includes experience in defining and evangelizing optimizations and best practices to build performing and scalable Data ingestion, processing, analytics/ML platforms

Experienced in Data engineering (we use state of the art open source data technologies such as the Apache Data ecosystem in a cloud native environment) and software development (Java, Python) as well as with automating cloud-based technologies, deploying applications

Which also means working knowledge of Cloud deployments (AWS/Azure) and Container/Orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes DevOps ecosystem).

Autonomous with strong interpersonal & communications skills, also familiar with Agile contexts.
That's ok if you don't tick all the boxes above, feel free to tell us why you'd still be a great fit for this role in your application


#LI-CL1

AND NOW, A LITTLE ABOUT US:

Talend has received some pretty impressive accolades along the way:

CEO named a 2020 Top Diverse Leader by the National Diversity Council
6th consecutive year named a Leader for Data Integration Tools in the Gartner Magic Quadrant 2021
4th consecutive year named as a Leader for Data Quality Solutions in Gartner Magic Quadrant 2021
Recognized as a Challenger for Enterprise Integration Platform as a Service (iPaaS) in Gartner Magic Quadrant 2021
Named Leader in The Forrester Wave™: Enterprise Data Fabric
Ranked in the DBTA “100 Companies that Matter Most in Data”
Listed in the CRN Big Data 100 Companies
We are passionate about helping companies become more data driven; and, if we can be honest, we are all geeks at heart who pride ourselves on the vibrant company culture that we have built.

As a global employer, Talend believes our success depends on diversity, inclusion and mutual respect among our team members. We want to look like our customers, and we recruit, Data Engineer 92150 Suresnes We design, setup develop and operate a reliable and robust central telemetry data service to develop internal data-driven analytics and smart customer facing…

Content:
SESAMm SESAMm
SESAMm (www.sesamm.com) extracts behavioral insights from millions of unstructured text data sources across the public internet in over 100 languages, helping clients distill valuable intelligence on businesses and their customers to make investment decisions and manage risk.

We work with many well-known firms around the world in private equity, investment banking, insurance, and asset management to apply Natural Language Processing and Artificial Intelligence algorithms to track e-reputation, competitive positioning, sentiment analysis, risk and ESG factors.

SESAMm is growing quickly, with over 90 team members around the globe and offices in Paris, New York, London, Metz, Tunis, and Tokyo.

Key technologies: Alternative Data, Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning and Quantitative Analysis.

Are you looking for a new challenge? Do you dream of joining a growing company, proposing new ideas, and taking part in innovative processes?

At SESAMm, everyone brings their ideas, skills, and creativity. We value collaboration, support and teamwork. We learn every day from the experience of this great team and we constantly take up new challenges. We are proud of the work accomplished and to participate in the success of this great adventure!
The Data Engineer Internship Role
As a data engineer, you will build and scale data components to key SESAMm products, such as raw data ingestion pipeline, job scheduling and ETL design/optimization, optimize the migration the Product Data Platform toward cloud or on-premise solutions, and setup the best data development practices for other tech members. Communicate the work of your team with weekly updates.
You will be joining a rapidly expanding team early in its growth cycle, which means you will have an opportunity to shape the team's culture.
Key Activities
Participation in design and implementation of robust and elastic data pipeline for our Text-based products (ingestion, processing, exposure):
Test and design state-of-the-art data ingestion pipelines
Implement efficient streaming services
Participation in the acquisition of new data sources
For each new data source, describe its feasibility and potential
Take part in the integration of the new data into the data lake
Develop data request tooling for Data Scientists and Technical teams
Ease the new data request engine
Optimize current queries
Used technologies: Spark, AWS-EMR, Kafka, SQL, MongoDB...
Desired Background and Skills
Education
Pursing a bachelor, master or engineering degree in Computer Science, data analytics or equivalent
Understanding of big data, distributed computing and database technologies
Experience with at least one programming (Python, Scala, etc.) languages ​​and SQL (i.e SQL, AWS Athena, etc.)
skills
Good communication and popularization skills: understand technical team needs and issues, collaborate with several internal teams. team player.
Additional skills: strong interest in data science/Natural Language Processing.
You should be able to work in a product team and show high motivation. This job requires autonomy, curiosity toward a changing environment and real dedication to solving problems for clients.
Good understanding of different databases and data storage technologies.
A first experience with Agile methodologies would be an asset.
Benefits of Working at SESAMm
Flexibility: Team members can work remotely and have the opportunity to work with colleagues around the world.

Work environment: SESAMm is multicultural, with technology, sales, and management teams in the US, France, and Tunisia making important contributions to thecompany's growth.

Career development: SESAMm is growing quickly, which means the opportunities for your own growth are continually expanding, and that you can shape the company's culture and evolution.

Professional evolution: SESAM values ​​training and knowledge-sharing. We organize internally and externally led training sessions and pay for access to educational platforms.

Transparency: You will be kept learned of the company's continuing evolution and performance through monthly "Ask Me Anything" meetings, frequent business/finance updates, and strategy-sharing discussions.

Well-being: Building a good culture is key to building a good business at SESAMm. We focus on being a learning organization that values ​​and supports teamwork, thoughtfulness, and work/life balance.
Job Specifics
Location: Paris/Metz
Type of contract: Internship
Start date: As soon as possible Data Engineer Intern (M/F) Paris (75) As a data engineer, you will build and scale data components to key SESAMm products, such as raw data ingestion pipeline, job scheduling and ETL design…

Company
Clarins is not just a leading cosmetics company. It is a committed family history, a spirit of innovation and independence. Today the leader in some of our markets, we are continuing our development in Europe and the Americas and accelerating our growth in Asia.

Content:
Famoco In just over 10 years, Famoco has become a reference in the field of new technologies.
How ? By combining a mobile hardware and software solution under Android and putting it in the hands of companies through a secure SaaS platform.
Whether in France (Paris and Rennes), Belgium (Brussels and Liège), China (Shenzhen) or Africa (Abidjan or Kampala) our teams share the same objective: to satisfy our more than 1,400 customers all over the world. world.
Famoco offers an inclusive and caring work environment, where all differences are taken into account and valued. We strongly believe that diversity makes our teams rich! We are for equal opportunities in hiring and this in a recruitment process advocating diversity and inclusion, to guarantee non-discrimination!
Our corporate culture can be summed up in 5 words: listening, benevolence, curiosity, challenge and result. Beyond that, we all share the desire to grow the company and are always delighted at the idea of ​​welcoming our new talents!
Famoco is looking for a Data Engineer to join the Data team.
As a Data Engineer, your mission will be to contribute to the data architecture put in place by the stakeholders of the Data team for internal and / or external analysis needs.
*
Your missions*
With the Data team, your main missions will be:
Participate in the development of a Data Product in its entirety (collection, transformation, analysis and visualization)
Imagine and set up dashboards for the visualization and analysis of data for the executive committee and managers
Develop and improve existing analytics to assess company performance (new ideas are welcome)
Combine information from multiple sources while maintaining data integrity and accuracy
Requirements
What we are looking for
Student preparing a diploma at Bac+4/5 level (engineering school or Master) in the field of development / analysis and data processing, ideally with a first experience in a company (internship and/or work-study program)
You master the Python language and are comfortable with code management tools (git)
Database knowledge (postgres or mysql)
Knowledge of Data Visualization tools (Metabase / Javascript (Vega)) is a plus.
You demonstrate strong analytical skills, a good sense of priorities and a good spirit of synthesis
Rigorous.se, you have an entrepreneurial spirit and you know how to be proactive
You show a great interest in innovation
Good english level
Benefits
A good health insurance (50% covered)
A Swile card (50% supported)
Transportation (50% covered)
Premises in the heart of Paris (4th arrondissement)
Paid vacation
Laptop according to your preferences (Mac or PC)
Access to the various Famoco events: Team Buildings, Game evenings, aperitif etc...
Liberty Gymlib subscription: Sport and wellness activities
A move to plan: our partner Settlesweet helps you find your future home!
Recruitment process
Call with an HR member
Technical testing
Interview with the President
Our commitment Recruitment!

You are an excellent communicator and you adapt to any situation, like a chameleon. It is even your totem animal.

Job description
For this year and those to come, our Data Science & Consulting (ODSC) division has very ambitious plans to further improve
the world [of our clients] using mathematics, data science and advanced analytical techniques. To make these plans, we need you as a Junior Data Engineer! Being part of our team means that you will be part of a mathematical and technical environment, at the forefront of new technologies and innovation in the fields of data science and engineering, operational research and analysis, where smart minds become multi-talented.

As a Junior Data Engineer F/H, you will be responsible for:
Build data ingestion and processing processes
Build and build robust and complex data infrastructures for data analysis and learning purposes
automatically in the cloud.
Manage various projects such as: the Internet, objects in the supply chain, forecasting applications for the
production and customer demand, to creating a centralized data environment for large enterprise management.
Management of the design, architecture, data quality, development and delivery of the various data-driven applications and associated functionalities (eg visualization, data catalog, training).
As part of an international team, you will have the opportunity to have a real impact on your sector(s) and benefit from the advantages of a multidisciplinary team by learning from each other and participating in social activities.
Required profile
Bac+4/5 training in Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Information Science or in other courses
relevant:
You are ready for the first or second stage of your career;
You are a very good communicator, autonomous and motivated by the vision, contact and interaction with customers;
You are able to work in a team, both remotely and at the client;
You have experience in computer system modeling and programming; Knowledge of SQL, R, Python and/or data modeling is an advantage; Knowledge of data visualization tools like Spofire, Tableau or
PowerBI is a plus;
You are ambitious and have an effective problem-solving approach;
You are able to communicate fluently in French and English (verbally and in writing).
Company
ORTEC is the world's leading provider of optimization software, advanced analytics and consulting services. For nearly 40 years, we've helped more than 1,200 organizations optimize their supply chains with solutions for transport operations optimization and management, loadout optimization, human resources planning, demand forecasting and deliveries and many more. We make our clients' businesses more efficient, predictable and successful by turning complex challenges into easy-to-use solutions.
ORTEC has approximately 1,000 employees worldwide and has offices in 13 countries. Our main office in France is in Paris 2nd. From our French offices, we support companies of all sizes (from the CAC40 to regional companies) in various sectors such as energy, retail, industry, logistics. We also work with our international clients by regularly supporting our other European and American offices.
Our people are recognized as the driving force behind our success. They typically hold a master's or bachelor's degree, have a highly developed talent for analytical thinking, and a drive to identify and solve complex problems. ORTEC's culture is open and informal, designed to promote collaboration and provide meaningful care and responsibility throughout your career.
We offer a pleasant and stimulating work environment where our employees are encouraged to take charge of their personal development. We believe it is important that our employees have the opportunity to give their best while maintaining a good work-life balance. Our growth and success can only be achieved by h employees. Junior Data Engineer F/H Paris 2e (75) For this year and those to come, our Data Science & Consulting (ODSC) division has very ambitious plans to improve further.

Our children are the most precious, and yet… How are the products they use made? What do they contain? Where are they made?
Here is Coqo's mission: to inform consumers about the health and environmental impacts of childcare products and allow them to consume in an informed way thanks to our mobile application (release scheduled for the end of March!).
As part of our development, we are looking for a Data Engineer on an apprenticeship contract for the 2022-2023 school year.
This alternation will offer you a unique experience in a strong entrepreneurial environment and will be a springboard to prepare you for taking up a position of responsibility!

In order to create an internal database in the field of childcare, your missions will be to:
Review the architecture of the database and familiarize yourself with it;
Collect data: scraping;
Go from raw data to usable: transform and clean;
Consolidate this data as you go.

Autonomy, proactivity, creativity, flexibility and enormous motivation;

Knowledge of PostgreSQL or MongoDB more than recommended;
Engineering training, IT, you have at least a first experience as a Data Engineer (internship / work-study program included).

We are ALE, serving more than 830,000 customers worldwide under the Alcatel-Lucent Enterprise brand*. Together with our partners, we provide customized Communication, Networks and Cloud solutions to our customers, aiming to improve their flexibility and growth.
Visit our website
As an apprentice Data Engineer/Scientist, we allow you to develop your skills and responsibilities throughout your experience. Thanks to our Apprenticeship Course, we provide you with personalized follow-up while leaving you enough freedom to show initiative. Finally, through our culture and our CSR commitments, we want to bring you exciting projects in a work environment combining an entrepreneurial and international spirit.

We are looking for a data scientist/engineer for our CTO (Chief Technology Office) team. Within the team and reporting to the Data/AI Manager, your main role is to participate in the development of the service which analyzes user communications by applying methods of social network analysis and natural language processing. In this context, you will work with the data generated by our Rainbow matchmaking service.

Your missions

Develop and maintain the data processing pipeline (Python, Kafka, Docker, Kubernetes, ClickHouse)
Develop calculation of statistics and other operations with data (Python)
Develop and maintain the API infrastructure of the solution (Python, REST)
Participate in data analysis and the application of AI/ML techniques in the areas of Social Network Analysis, Natural Language Processing and possibly sentiment detection.
Monitor trends on the scientific and operational approach to data processing: technologies, methods, problems/solutions

You are passionate about technologies in the fields of data processing / Artificial Intelligence.
You master Python (Kafka, Docker, Kubernetes are a plus).
You are creative and proactive.
You are rigorous, autonomous.

Dynamic, you know how to defend your ideas and argue your design choices in front of a varied audience, while remaining open to feedback. Teamwork is important to you, you like to discuss your working methods, this job could be yours from the start of the school year.

We are looking for a student with a baccalaureate +3 minimum in Computer Engineering School, University Option Computer Science, specialization in Artificial Intelligence

Content:
Société Générale Your daily tasks
Do you know how to “make the data speak” to create value? Do you want to improve your skills in a promising field? Join us !
We invite you to join the DataLab of our entity as a Data engineer / Data scientist. You will benefit from both methodological and educational support in terms of data access and analysis, but also the opportunity to participate in the "data community" within its DataLab and at Group level.
In concrete terms, you will be led, under the supervision of your tutor and/or your manager, to
Understand the challenges of the Business and ensure that the model meets the needs of the user
Identify the needs of the Business with regard to a targeted problem and in various areas of the Bank: fraud, marketing (product appetite, moments of life, attrition, customer journey, etc.), risk management (granting of credit, pricing, probability of default)
Develop, in conjunction with the Data Engineers, the tools necessary for data collection in completeness, in history, in sufficient frequency and quality, upstream of modeling
Model data using mathematical algorithms: machine learning, NLP, Artificial Intelligence, etc.
Synthesize and communicate the results of mass data analyzes to extract decision-making knowledge that can be easily interpreted and manipulated by the beneficiaries
Design, implement and formalize an automatic re-learning framework on supervised binary classification topics in the field of marketing
And if it were you ?
You are a Bac+4/5 level student in University, Business School, Engineering School, with a specialization in Data.
You demonstrate a strong appetite for data-related topics and demonstrate in-depth knowledge of the fields of data mining and machine learning, particularly from an algorithmic point of view.
You master programming: Python, Scala, R and algorithms/database management: SPARK, SQL, noSQL, Hadoop
You have skills in data visualization (and associated tools, dash type), seeing in user experience (UX) is a plus.
You're fluent in english? You are the ideal candidate!
More than a job, a springboard
As soon as you arrive, you will be integrated into our teams and will learn every day alongside our experts who will accompany you in your missions. Gradually, you will gain autonomy in your projects to make this experience a real career accelerator. You will also discover all the diversity of our professions, in a sector that is constantly evolving and innovating.
At the end of your studies, various opportunities may be available to you, in France and abroad.
Why choose us ?
At Societe Generale, we are convinced that people are drivers of change, and that the world of tomorrow will be made up of all their initiatives, from the smallest to the most ambitious.
Whether you join us for a few months, a few years or your entire career, together we have the means to have a positive impact on the future.
Creating, daring, innovating, undertaking are part of our DNA. If you also want to be in the action, evolve in a stimulating and caring environment, feel useful on a daily basis and develop or strengthen your expertise, we are made to meet!
Are you still hesitating?
Please note that our employees can commit a few days a year to solidarity actions during their working hours: sponsor people who are having difficulty in their orientation or their professional integration, participate in the financial education of young people in apprenticeship or even share their skills with an association. There are many forms of engagement.
We are an equal opportunity employer and we are proud to make diversity a strength for our company. The group is committed to recognizing and promoting all talents, regardless of their beliefs, age, disability, parenthood, ethnic origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, membership of a political or religious organization, trade union or minority, or any other characteristic that could be subject to discrimination.

Content:
CASTLE BEE - Data & Cloud Factory About Castle Bee:
Castle Bee is a Data & Cloud Foundery. We offer tailor-made and industrializable use cases for our customers. Our business and technological expertise allows us to build adapted architectures interconnected via API to the client's IS.
Our main areas of intervention:
Industry 4.0: automated quality control, automatic fault detection, predictive maintenance, optimization
Customer knowledge: segmentation, prediction of attrition risk, establishment of customer scores, recommendation engines
Innovation: proposing the use cases of tomorrow, with pragmatism and sobriety
We recruit our future employees on 4 fundamental principles:
Ability to adapt to the business interlocutor to define his need, ability to popularize and translate a business need into functionalities and algorithms
You will very often have to discuss with a business department to define their needs. Production, R&D, Marketing, HR, they are not in the business, and your ability to support them in defining their needs and popularizing is essential to ensure a successful and industrialized use case.
Data preparation is a crucial and time-consuming step. You must be aware
Modeling in collaboration with data engineers and IS teams, to best prepare for industrialization. No silos at Castle Bee!
Prioritize quick wins, keep it simple and avoid the black box effect! And from experience, simplicity does not always lie in deep learning
The challenge in joining us is to contribute to the animation of our Data community, to the construction and development of innovative projects and to become a referent within society.
Our goal is also to guarantee a regular increase in skills to our community. Training, technical support, peer programming and challenges will be offered to you to stay in constant progress.
Because it is our employees who drive society forward, every idea for projects, events and publications will be studied. We will build the future of society with our community.
Job description:
As a Data Engineer at Castle Bee, you will be integrated into our client's Data team. This team works internally for the development and industrialization of use cases to meet the needs expressed by the business departments.
Your achievements will be:
Data ingestion on the different models
Data recovery via API
Deployment of use cases
DevOps Data chain design and modification "DataOps"
Provide support and/or training to end users
Technical environment :
Languages: Java, Scala, Python
Framework: Spark
Cloud: Azure (ADLS, Synapse, Power Bi, DataBricks...)
Profile: With a Grande Ecole engineering background (ideally Centrale Supélec, Mines, Télécom Paris, etc.), you must have 3 years of experience and:
Good knowledge of Java / Scala languages
Good knowledge of the Python language (script + POO)
Good command of Spark
Good command of Azure
Beyond technical expertise, we are looking for collaborators who share our mindset and our values, who will be proactive, collaborative, curious and who will create value within our Data community.
So if these values ​​speak to you, join the hive!

Content:
Sewan Sewan is embarking on a new project and is looking for talent to create a team whose mission will be the standardization and development of our internal information system and the integration of our Data Lake into its processes, in order to provide decision support tools and metrics and make Sewan a data-driven company.
This team, multidisciplinary in essence, will have to know how to develop, analyze and design tools for the various departments of the company by taking as source the data and applications currently in place and by respecting the rules of urbanization and the functional standards in place. .

the implementation and maintenance of a fluid and rigorous integration between our different applications;

developers — knowledge of development will therefore be a very appreciated plus,

Content:
American Express Global Business Travel Egencia is at the center of revolutionizing business travel with our cutting edge technology and the most desirable products in the industry. We have grown from a small start-up to become the 5th largest corporate travel management company in the world!

How often do you get the opportunity to work in what feels like a startup environment but has funding of our parent company? That's what you would be doing if you were to become a Principal Data Engineer at Egencia. The team's responsibilities span data integration supporting customers and internal business area and report development. We are looking for an exceptional data engineer, a passionate technologist and dedicated to solving real-world business problems; to lead the excellence of data engineering practice.

What you'll do:
Partner with technologists across the business to collaboratively solve problems.
Demonstrates active mentorship and rising talent identification.
Develops north star vision for domain in which they are focused.
Demonstrates positive impact and leadership across scope of the organization.
Serves as a specialist in architecting design solution patterns to any use case. Considers business needs, application needs and articulating to interested teams and partners.
Demonstrates mastery of software design, shapes coding methodologies that is scalable, resilient and stable.
Possess a deep knowledge of entire system and can jump into code in any component and fire fight and contribute.
Expertise of professional software engineering practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.
Leads collaboration with key partners and contributes subject matter expertise to develop unique solutions to complex issues.
Who you are:
7+ years for Bachelor's or equivalent, 5+ years for Master's
Proven experience in data modeling, schema design patterns and modern data access patterns (including API, stream, data lake) and AWS
Demonstrates familiarity with various cloud technologies and building data products to support batch and real-time DS, ML and Deep learning applications.
Independently designs, communicates and executes on architecture for moderately sophisticated data products.

Content:
Younited Credit At Younited, we believe that money is a way to realize your dreams through projects and purchases. But the banking products currently offered are too often opaque and complicated.
Our constant innovation and state-of-the-art technologies allow us to redefine credit and payment practices, in order to offer an exceptional user experience for more transparency and inclusion. We want to help our clients achieve financial serenity.
For this, our mission is to become the trusted financial partner of Europeans.
We have initiated a B-Corp certification process, our social and environmental impact being at the heart of our strategic concerns.
We provide both credit and payment solutions directly to consumers (Younited Credit / Younited Pay) and through partners (banks, fintech & insurers who want to develop consumer and retail lending activities, telcos, e -merchants who wish to offer their customers the simplest method of paying in installments).
We also offer budget optimization solutions via "Younited Coach" to all consumers wishing to receive personalized recommendations.
Some key figures on the Younited group:

1 million customers in 5 European countries (50% of its activity outside France).
330 million euros of equity raised since the launch
More than 550 Younies employed in our offices in Paris, Rome, Barcelona, ​​Lisbon and Munich.
Numerous partnerships with prestigious players such as Free, Bouygues, Orange Bank, Microsoft, Bpifrance, Apple, N26, Fortuneo and Lydia.
Our 5 corporate values ​​that guide us on a daily basis:
Make it Simple: At all levels of the customer experience or the organization: Be transparent.
Act as an entrepreneur: Working as a team. Dare, try, accept failure.
Innovate or die: Challenging the status quo even if it seems impossible.
Faster is better: Value speed over perfection. Align on priorities.
No limit: Be ambitious, stay humble.
We empower passionate people to collaborate, innovate and perform at their best.

We build diverse and inclusive teams around the world because that's how we create even better experiences for our customers and partners. For this, we need your help. So join us to build tomorrow, today

context

As a Senior Data Engineer, you will join the Data Engineering team, the most cross-functional team of all Younited, in contact with all the businesses and in charge of imagining the best database without everything collapsing!
Your missions
Develop and maintain our ELT jobs with PySpark and Airflow,
Participate in the design, maintenance and documentation of our Warehouse on Google BigQuery,
Develop tools to improve data quality monitoring,
Support business teams in their data needs,
Collaborate with the Data Science and Data Analysis teams to continue to develop our data platform and the competitive advantage it represents,
Participate in the implementation of a real-time Kafka platform.
Your profile
Bac +5 in engineering school or university equivalent,
+5 years as Software or Data Engineer,
Good knowledge of SQL language and BigData environments,
Big plus if you have DevOps experience setting up data architecture in the Cloud (Hadoop, Airflow, Kafka), or experience as a full stack Python developer,
Good capacity for autonomy and likes to be proactive,
You like challenges, the entrepreneurial spirit and the dynamism of start-ups,
You like teamwork,
You speak English fluently.
Recruitment process:

A first video chat with Camille, Lead Talent Acquisition, to get to know each other and tell you more about Younited, our corporate culture & our values ​​(30’)
A video chat with David, Engineering Manager (60’)
A peer-programming exercise to test your knowledge (30’)
A meeting with members of your future team to give you a complete overview of what your daily life will be like! (60')

The advantages of joining Younited?

Offices located in the heart of Paris (9th arrondissement)
An international work environment and the opportunity to go on a mission in our offices abroad (Barcelona, ​​Munich, Rome)
An entrepreneurial mindset and a strong team spirit
Individualized managerial and HR support during onboarding and throughout the Younited adventure
A continuous learning environment with the possibility of benefiting from individual and collective training and “Friday workshops” at the Tech
Particular attention to work/life balance Senior Data Engineer (F/M) Télétravail hybride in Paris (75) Collaborate with the Data Science and Data Analysis teams to continue to develop our data platform and the competitive advantage it represents.

Content:
wefox wefox is the world’s leading Insurtech that is reinventing insurance at scale, with a record-breaking Series C funding round of $650 million in 2021, making it the largest funding round of any Insurtech to date.

wefox is revolutionizing insurance by empowering the customer and delivering personalized experiences, driven by data. Our vision is to make insurance simple and 10x better. By providing our customers 360-degree advice through our network of advisors, we optimize each individual's risk coverage through innovative prevention, assistance and insurance products.

Role:
We are currently looking for a data engineer to join our team in Paris. The team is the wefox’s Advanced Innovation Team and our focus, as a cross-functional team, is to leverage machine learning to improve the customer experience, and to deliver innovative products like risk detection and risk prevention. As a data engineer you will be involved throughout the lifecycle of the development, with the responsibility of data workflows development: architecture, implementation, deployment and maintenance of data pipelines for machine learning.

Responsibilities:
Design, implement, deploy, with your agile team, data pipelines to feed machine learning models.
Contribute in all phases of the development life cycle, and take ownership of your deployed data architecture and data pipelines.
Write well designed, testable and efficient code.
Work closely with product owners, devops, machine learning engineers, software engineers in an agile cross-functional team.
Develop relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
Have a strategic and continuous improvement mentality.
Love for new technologies, clean architecture, coding in a decoupled way.
Keep abreast of industry news / updates and share your discoveries with others
What you bring:
Strong development skills to work on data processing with Python and/or Scala and/or other programming languages.
Knowledge and experience with data-related Python packages.
2+ years of experience in data science / data engineering.
Experience with relational and non-relational DB.
Experience with Docker, kubernetes, build and CI/CD tools is a plus
Experience in code/system optimization is a plus
Interest in machine learning.
Experience in understanding product requirements.
Embrace ownership, autonomy and agile methodology.
Good English proficiency (Work in an international environment).
What we offer:
Now, we've gotten to the fun part, the part where you get to brag about your company, those perks your friends are so jealous of!

Here are some of them:
Flexible working hours including hybrid working
Free access to a mental health and well-being platform for personalized care, such as 1:1 coaching and therapy sessions for life’s ups and downs — whether at work, at home, or in your relationships
A stack of the latest technologies and working gadgets
Training and Coaching opportunities
Free coffee, fruit, and snacks because we need fuel!
If you love a less-formal work environment, flexible paid time off, a great compensation package and benefits offering - and most of all, being the authentic you, get in touch, we want to meet you!

Your contact person for this role is Tony Veloso

We are an equal opportunity employer and values ​​diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

Content:
CleverConnect Company Description

Created by engineers, CleverConnect is a fast-growing HRtech player (+50% growth). We strive to provide millions of candidates with the right job. To do this, we connect recruiters and candidates with innovative solutions and platforms to make the recruitment process more efficient.
What are our solutions and platforms?
A pioneer in recruitment matching technologies (HRMatch), we offer candidates specific job offers on our clients' career sites (in 22 languages). Meteojob.com, one of the main French job sites, also relies on this technology.
Visiotalent, allows candidates to showcase their personality and general skills beyond their CV, thanks to short videos shared with recruiters.
Our Smart Career Websites are fully customizable, high-performance platforms to attract candidates and allow recruiters to better assess their soft skills.
Beyond our successes in France, we are developing our presence in Europe! We are already present in Spain and Italy, and we will soon be present in Germany.
Today we support nearly 10 million candidates in France and Europe

Job Description

To support our strong growth, we are looking for Data Scientists to join our talented teams who share a common passion for distributed services, scalability and continuous development.
As part of our dynamic Tech team, you are in charge of designing, developing, delivering and maintaining our platform. You contribute to the creation and deployment of robust, high-performance and high-availability services.
More precisely:
You collaborate within a Data team with the Product Manager, Data Engineer and Software Engineers to design and build data processing solutions that meet the needs of our customers.
You transform raw data into insightful analyzes characterized by excellent governance, transparency on the techniques used and clear documentation.
You design and build distributed data processing services based on Data Science such as NLP.
You establish models using Machine Learning algorithms to simplify the search for the candidate as well as that of the recruiter.
Thanks to your mastery of data science, you identify opportunities to improve the platform and support our customers through the application in their decision-making.
You design and analyze rigorous experiments, help teams define relevant hypotheses and deliver solid analyzes of the results obtained.
You identify the metrics actionable by our customers. You then develop dashboards and reports to monitor and anticipate activity.

Qualifications

You are a results-oriented data scientist with proven experience in data analysis, NLP and predictive modeling.
Specifically, as a Data Scientist ‍‍:
You are proficient in Python and SQL
You master the Scikit, Numpy, Pytorch, Pandas libraries…
You have experience with Machine Learning methods and frameworks such as Tensorflow and their implementation
You are familiar with development practices such as version control (git), testing frameworks, code review and CI/CD.
You have an excellent command of databases, schema design and optimization techniques as well as a good knowledge of NoSQL Databases.
You are familiar with the AWS or GCP Cloud ecosystem.
You have experience with data visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau or other.
You have an analytical mind that enjoys solving complex problems.
You are rigorous and pay great attention to detail.
You are looking for efficiency and automation of your tasks.
You have a bac+5 in Computer Science and Mathematics.
You have a good command of English

Content:
Twenty One Talents Within the technical team, you will join experienced engineers working in different human-sized teams: backend, frontend, data engineering, business intelligence, machine learning, audio R&D.

The team is responsible for the company's next major product: the creativity apps ecosystem. We focus on building highly scalable systems to provide the best possible user experience.
Our stack is mostly Go for the backend, React for the frontend, Python and C/C++ for the R&D team.

Our stack also includes many services from Google Cloud Platform, as well as the Elastic Stack, Redis, and other cool stuff!
As part of an overall mission to support its growth, you will be responsible for building the toolset that other teams need to succeed and achieve their goals.

Design, develop and maintain backend applications,

Build data acquisition pipelines and databases to support other business units in their decisions,

Inject layers of Machine Learning or Deep Learning into existing workflows to increase their performance.
Over the years, we have become one of the most promising French startups in the French Tech ecosystem. World leader in creative apps, the company is 450 million downloads worldwide with more than 30 apps in music, drawing, photo and video.
For people looking for a challenge in their professional life, this is the perfect place for them. Here, they will create apps used by millions of people around the world. They will take their place in a team in constant search of perfection and technical independence. They will be masters of their projects and will work as an independent team to design the blockbusters of tomorrow.
Holder of a master's degree in data science or computer science,
3+ years of experience in a data-related position (Data Scientist, Data Engineer, etc.) with strong software engineering challenges,
A true data culture: having a high-level understanding of the flow of data, from its extraction to its final use,
Eager to explore machine learning/deep learning in depth and write your custom implementations,
You have a passion for optimized and well-designed processes (this matters a lot in "Big Data"),
Good communication skills and you know how to work in a team,
Fluent in French, and a good level in English (all technical work is done in English).

@ candidates will find
An ecosystem: Scale-up in full growth, profitable for several years, we have the privilege of evolving in a consumer market with almost unlimited potential. Whether it's collaborating with DJs, working closely with tech giants such as Google or Apple, or designing new levels in our own video game studio, our universe is rich and varied!
A relaxed and motivating working atmosphere: free gym on the premises, fresh fruit, unlimited snacks and drinks. A brunch and a visit from the hairdresser, manicure and osteo at the office every month. A space for relaxation and games, a personal parking space, a meal voucher, many afterworks & various activities, a team building like the one we just did in Mykonos.
RESTO TICKETS

COMPANY MUTUAL
⭐ Attractive compensation including, among other things, a profit-sharing bonus, a company savings plan - not to mention many career opportunities! Senior Data Engineer - Paris Paris (75) Build data acquisition pipelines and databases to support other business units in their decisions.

Content:
Ubisoft Company Description

Ubisoft teams have 21,000 people spread over more than 40 sites around the world and are linked by a common mission: to enrich the lives of players through original and memorable gaming experiences. Their energy and talent have helped bring to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin's Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer and believes that diversity of backgrounds and perspectives is essential to creating worlds that allow everyone to thrive and express themselves. If you're excited to take on exciting challenges, harness cutting-edge technologies, and take part in the future of entertainment, join us and create the unknown.

Job Description

For several years, Ubisoft has set up teams and tools dedicated to data in order to improve the experience of its games and the management of its activities. The company took a new step in 2019 by creating the Data Office, a global team reporting directly to the CEO whose mission is to make data a strategic asset for the company. To achieve this objective, the department aims to improve the pooling, sharing and use of data initiatives within the group.
We are therefore currently looking for a Senior Data Engineer to join the Data Architecture team where his main mission will be to lead Data Quality projects. Working in close collaboration with all Ubisoft Data Office teams, he will have to design, enrich and develop new transversal tools.
Your main tasks will be to:
Monitor and improve data quality within Ubisoft Data Office;
Participate in the design / development / and maintenance of data quality tools within Ubisoft Data Office:
1. Data quality framework;
2.ETL framework;
3. Migration tool;
4.Customer Support API.
Facilitate Agile ceremonies;
Collaborate with project teams for the development of new features and bug fixes;
Provide support on data quality tools;
Stay abreast of technological advances to help develop our best practices

Qualifications

Background
Significant experience (minimum 4 years) in data engineering is required for the position, ideally with knowledge of Quality Control or Data Quality Management.
Required Skills
Mastery of SQL languages ​​(knowing Snowflake is a plus) & Python.
Good knowledge of the Linux environment.
Strong critical thinking, communication and interpersonal skills.
Fluent English.
Bonus Skills:
Skills in web development (front-end).
Knowledge of major DevOps principles (CI / CD, automation & configuration, etc.).
Experience with big data technologies (eg Kafka, Hadoop, Hive, HBase, Spark, etc).

Additional Information

Recruitment process
[30 minutes]: Phone conversation with a Recruiter
[60 minutes]: Interview (video) with the job manager and a Recruiter
[60 minutes]: Technical interview with the workstation manager and a member of the Data Architecture teams

Benefits at Ubisoft
Incentive and participation, company savings plan. In addition: 25 CP, 12 RTT, 50% of the Navigo pass covered, restaurant tickets, good mutual insurance, and lots of Ubisoft advantages.
Our new premises are in Saint Mandé (line 1, Saint Mandé stop), gym on the premises.
As an employer, Ubisoft offers everyone the same employment opportunities without distinction of gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, social status, disability and age. Ubisoft strives to develop an inclusive work environment that reflects the diversity of its community of players in its teams Senior Data Engineer (F/H/NB) 94160 Saint-Mandé Provide support on data quality tools;
Experience with big data technologies (eg Kafka, Hadoop, Hive, HBase, Spark, etc).

Content:
Kpler In a world where trades are happening faster than ever to answer our needs, where sustainability is not just an option anymore, clarity and trust in the information we trade with are a must.

So, say hello to Kpler! We exist to facilitate sustainable and efficient trade to meet the changing needs of our world. To do so we've built a Data-as-a-Service solution that does exactly that across the lifecycle of a trade.

Our solution aggregates data from hundreds of sources including radar and satellite imagery as well as logistics, governmental, shipping databases and more. Intelligently connecting the dots across fragmented information landscapes, we bring to our clients a unique, real-time understanding of the trades happening all over the world, by giving them access to live information about the movement of cargos, the availability of vessels as well as the commodity storage.

To support this endeavor we have teams in more than 7 countries and 8 key locations (Brussels, Paris, London, Vienna, Dubai, Singapore, Houston and New York). With individuals of various backgrounds, diverse skills, and international experiences, being global & inclusive is in our DNA!

Our values

Be humble - We always place the interests of the collective before your own.
Respect and care for others - We make every person feel comfortable in their own beliefs, decisions, and perspectives.
Take responsibility - We take ownership of our actions
Act with integrity - We are honest and transparent in all your dealings.
Be bold - We push the boundaries in order to improve and grow.

You'll get to work in a truly global environment, with more than 30 nationalities speaking more than 15 languages.

What you'll do

You will participate in the evolution of our platform app.kpler.com ( code, test, deployment, support) and derived applications with the aim of extracting ( API, scraping), consolidating, ( ETL), and applying algorithms ( data-mining , business rules) on large data sets, and make them available (Postgres, ElasticSearch).

For example, you will improve our vessel destination forecast algorithm.
You will be tested on, and expected to work with the following stack:
Python, Posgresql, SQLAlchemy, ElasticSearch, AWS, Kafka...

The technical team works in lean mode to continually improve our SaaS applications and API.

You may be a fit if...

Python and ideally with a first experience in startups
Knowledge in Scala could be a plus
Crafty, handy and pragmatic, you code on Linux / Mac and are both comfortable with CLI and graphical interfaces
You commit on Open source projects and you are present on GitHub
There is more than 12 different nationalities at Kpler, you must be able to interact with all team members in a functional English

Why you REALLY need to join us...

Interesting product & challenging technical problems to solve: our market is very specialized and quite complicated! This means we build real algos and there's some serious software engineering at work here!
Our growth is exponential: we build new features and products everyday! We frequently tackle brand new business areas which means there's always everything to build and always an interesting problem to sink your teeth into!
We are still small enough that you can get exposure to our entire tech architecture, be close to the business and the impact you are making and build your career trying out different things!
We are at the cross-road of software engineering, energy and finance: This creates an interesting mix. We value the flexibility, collaboration and employee-centric approach that the Tech culture bring but we also value the pragmatism, hard-working and intellectual excellence expectation that often runs in the Finance and Energy worlds.
You'll get to work in a truly global work environment: With offices in 6 countries, we have more than 30 nationalities and speak more than 15 languages.
We offer competitive compensation & benefits and are looking for feedback and opportunity to improve them everyday!

#LI-Remote

Our People Pledge

Kpler is committed to providing a fair, inclusive and diverse work-environment. We believe that different perspectives lead to better ideas, and better ideas allow us to better understand the needs and interests of our diverse, global community. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives and are an equal opportunity employer. Content:
BNP Paribas Data Engineer M/F

Concretely your daily life?
This position will consist of providing STFS with the data necessary for credit stress tests.
As a Data Engineer, you will understand the necessary requirements for performing the various stress test exercises. You will participate in the formulation of the request/need specification, collect the data, process it, analyze it and structure it.
This will require functional knowledge of credit and specific business needs of the STFS Modeling Team (STMM).
The database resulting from this work will be provided to STMM and the stress test engine in order to be able to carry out projections of weighted assets and the cost of risk, dependent on macroeconomic scenarios.


This work will require a good level of communication and a very good capacity for teamwork, within STFS on the one hand and with the business lines (domestic markets, CIB, PF, IRB) and group functions (RISK and FINANCE) on the other hand.
Data is at the heart of the need for credit stress tests. In an ever more demanding regulatory environment, our ability to prepare it and return it in short times, with optimal quality, are key.
The work environment is important!
BNP PARIBAS Group Finance, RISK and ALM Treasury have set up a JV team in charge of Group stress testing, financial planning and financial synthesis called STFS for Stress Testing and Financial Synthesis.
Within the STFS platform, Stress Testing and Data Analytics (STDA), is responsible for providing the data needed to perform internal and regulatory stress test exercises on all of the group's material risks (credit, securitization, banking book market risk, etc.). STDA is also responsible for certain regulatory reporting in which STFS is involved.
The team is made up of functional experts in order to understand and formalize the need for data, but also technical experts in order to structure, control and develop solutions for making this data available. On credit, engine databases are made available to the group stress test engine to provide risk-weighted asset and cost of risk projections. STDA is one of the main users of the group's stress testing platform (PROMETHEE).
The position is based at Millénaire 1, Paris 19th. You will be able to telecommute up to 2.5 days a week.
And after ?
This cross-functional position offers many opportunities to work with players in many regions and to apprehend and understand the different businesses within the Group.
And the pay?
We will know how to value your talent. Let's discuss it!
Why BNP Paribas?
Our world is changing: our way of informing ourselves, of consuming… and of working too! Today, what counts in a job is to live real experiences, to learn, to share objectives and results with colleagues.

In short, to chart your own path, different, responsible and sustainable.
At BNP Paribas, we recruit our employees with the idea that they will help us design the world and the bank of tomorrow.
Want to know all the reasons to join us? Go to www.bnpparibas.com
And you?
You are a graduate of a Bac+5 and you have at least 5 years' experience as a data analyst in risk/finance. You are proficient in SQL and Python.
Your level of English is advanced both orally and in writing.
You have developed good abilities to collaborate and communicate.
Your rigor, your analytical skills combined with your organizational skills will be assets to succeed in this position.
In a changing world, diversity, equity and inclusion are key values ​​for the well-being and performance of teams.
At BNP Paribas, we want to welcome and retain all talents without distinction: this is how we will build, together, the finance of tomorrow, innovative, responsible and sustainable.


Finally, we attach particular importance to ensuring that our future employees act on a daily basis with ethical and professional responsibility.


At any time during the recruitment process, the information on your CV, your identification data and your background may be checked. Data Engineer H/F Paris (75)
+ 1 lieu This position will consist of providing STFS with the data necessary for credit stress tests.
As a Data Engineer, you will understand the needs...

Content:
Assystem About Assystem
For 50 years, we have been driven by the conviction that engineers, through their audacity, their expertise and their ability to move the lines, are the architects of the world of tomorrow.
Every day, our 6,000 employees innovate in contact with their customers and contribute to accelerating the energy transition all over the world. They support the largest global engineering projects in the fields of energy, digital and transport.
A fast-growing international group, we are present in 13 countries (Europe, Middle East, Asia, Africa).

The arrival of digitalization in industrial infrastructures has created new needs and new opportunities. The world of engineering is changing rapidly and the progress of digitization relies in particular on a massive amount of usable data, to improve the performance of installations.

Within its Digital division, Assystem supports its customers with consulting and solution integration services, drawing on its expertise in artificial intelligence, application development for businesses, system engineering and digital tools. associates.

Digital is rejuvenating the way projects are developed and thus changing the way project management and engineering could be performed, taking advantage of the new possibilities offered by available digital technologies.
ASSYSTEM has embarked on an initiative called "Engineering Powered By Digital" to offer advanced services to improve the competitiveness of the services offered, the delivery performance of projects and to be able to achieve the optimal solution(s) in the ambient complexity.
Attached to the Data Science team within Assystem's Digital Division, you actively participate in the development of Documents to Data projects for both internal and external clients.
Your main objective will be twofold:
Apply various techniques and models to ensure the delivery of digitalization projects,

So join us and take the engineering of tomorrow by leaps and bounds!

We are committed to respecting the equal treatment of candidates, and celebrate all forms of diversity. At Assystem, only skills count!
