Job description:
You will be required to work on various innovative projects, for clients of all sizes, in various and varied sectors such as agri-food, trade, distribution, banking, finance, luxury, energy , industry, pharma/chemistry or health.
As a passionate Data Engineer, you will help our customers meet the challenges of today and tomorrow by integrating their data into infrastructures, On-Premise and Cloud. Following an integration period intended to familiarize you with the Actinvision methodology, you will be involved in all project phases, from the analysis of customer needs to the delivery of the technical solution, including costing and developments. . You will evolve in a team but also independently in a technical environment that brings innovations including, for example, the modeling and construction of data warehouses (Data Warehouses), the design of integration flows using tools (e.g. Talend or ADF, Matillion etc. ) allowing the latter to be fed, or even the implementation and optimization in compliance with good Data architecture practices, in particular Cloud (e.g. Snowflake or Azure).
Skills development is a key aspect. This continuous development is supported by official resources made available by all of Actinvision's partner publishers and supplemented by internal resources. The skills acquired can be valued through highly qualifying publisher certifications.
MAIN MISSIONS :
Participate in a team or independently in the implementation of Data / Business Intelligence (BI) projects, focusing mainly on the integration and storage of data
Collection of technical and functional customer needs allowing the implementation of architectures for the collection and extraction of data from various sources (Cloud databases, business applications, APIs, etc.), the manipulation and transformation of this data , then loading its latest in Data Warehouses (DWH) type database
Design of Data infrastructures/architectures and modeling of target DWHs, which will mainly be used in the context of Reporting and/or Data Visualization operations
Realization of integration flows and data transformation
Profile description:
Bac+5 training in computer science, you have at least 1 year of experience in a similar position.
Know-how, technical skills required:
SQL language and DWH modeling
Practice of an ETL / ELT integration tool
Knowledge of relational databases (e.g. SQL Server or MySQL)
Knowledge of a Cloud Data platform (Snowflake, Azure, AWS or GCP)
Knowledge of the Data value chain, and particularly of BI
Know-how, technical skills appreciated:
Knowledge of Cloud architectures (security, performance, cost control, etc.)
Procedural programming, e.g. T-SQL or PL/SQL
An object-oriented programming language, e.g. Java or Python
At ease with the use of API / Web Services
Notions on BSE
Soft skills, functional skills:
Passion for Data
Autonomy / Work and team spirit (including knowledge sharing)
Strength of proposal / Ability to seek and find solutions
Creativity and curiosity
Dynamism and responsiveness
Sense of service
Ability to participate in the animation of the community (internal and external)
Technical English
For a confirmed position: Proven experience in the fields of DWH and data integration (cloud and/or on-prem)

CERBA HEALTHCARE GESTION As part of its implementation of a Group Data platform, the Cerba HealthCare group is looking for an experienced Group Data Engineer who will be responsible for structuring and cross-referencing a multitude of data sources so that those -these are operational for use (data analyst/data scientist).
In order to enhance these databases, it mainly intervenes in the collection, storage and provision of data.

Reporting to the Group BI manager, you join the Group data team on 2 levels of intervention:

1) The BI France solution
The BI France solution integrates a large scope of data, because we are constantly enriching it.

You are involved in:
Integration of new data perimeters into the existing solution
The provision of data in the database / cube data models (collection, etl, storage, structuring and occasionally cube and reporting)

Technical documentation

The architecture is on-premise on technologies:
SQLserver
MS BI (SSIS, SSRS, SSAS (mdx+dax))
Power BI

The Group is currently transforming to set up a data mesh architecture on the Azure cloud for all subsidiaries.

Data development to port/rebuild the current solution on the cloud
Set up the necessary data developments of new services related to the data mesh

The architecture is Azure cloud on technologies being defined but is profiled around:
Base: snowflake/azure db sql/synapse
ETL: adf, pipeline optimization
Storage: data lake
Structuring / exposure of the data
DevOps

You have similar experience as a Data engineer with on-premise and cloud experience of at least 3 to 5 years on data collection technologies and creation of a database,
Demonstrate an interest in the broad sense of data subjects and in the field of health.

Curious, motivated, good interpersonal skills and good team spirit
You are fluent in English

AUDACITY: We promote the entrepreneurial spirit and encourage initiative within all of our activities to dare and explore new ways to advance diagnosis.

REQUIREMENT: We act with the greatest rigor to improve the quality of our services, and develop the men and women of the company to obtain the best from each person at the service of all.

RESPECT: We consider each individual with kindness and cultivate respect in our relationships with our teams, partners, healthcare professionals and patients for whom we work on a daily basis.

COMMITMENT: We are committed to doctors, patients, our industrial and institutional partners to deliver fair and useful results to improve everyone's health.

If this offer interests you, please send us a CV!

Avisto AViSTO is looking for a Data Engineer to act as a Data Engineer/Data scientist within a data processing project in the semiconductor sector.
You work from our design office within the Data Analystics team.

In this context, your missions are as follows:
Apply data analysis techniques to improve current working methods.
Exploit automatic learning (Machine Learning) and Artificial Intelligence methods to develop predictive analyses.
Predict and improve the use of future and existing tools.

Position available immediately. Teleworking possible. Salary between 38 and 48k.

Required profile
Trained as an engineer in computer science and/or electronics, you have significant experience in data analysis/data engineering.

Required Skills:
Mastery of Python and Machine Learning libraries.
Data analytics knowledge: Rangling data, AWS, Power BI, Tableau, data process pipelines
Knowledge of the world of semiconductors is highly appreciated.
Very good written and oral expression in English

You want to work on challenging technical projects within a team of passionate engineers. You want to evolve in a company on a human scale.

About Avisto
AViSTO is an engineering company whose vocation is the development of software solutions, founded and managed by engineers. She specializes in carrying out complex projects using Object (Java/JEE, C++, C# .Net Core, Python, PHP), Web (Angular, ReactJS, VueJS) and Mobile (Android, iOS, cross-platform) technologies. To this core competence, AViSTO has gradually added professions complementary to software development, in particular DevOps, quality assurance, data science and cybersecurity. Joining AViSTO means integrating a community of IT specialists who are passionate about their profession. and by new technologies. The projects carried out are ambitious, in environments where high technology and innovation are fully expressed, whether in our R&D centers or directly on the premises of our customers. Do you like technical challenges? Do you want to evolve in a benevolent atmosphere? To integrate a family structure with the advantages of a large group? So let's meet! Meetic Group is the European leader in dating services and present in 16 countries. A key French Tech company, on a human scale, while having the support and solidity of an international group, we have ambitions and the ability to achieve them!

In recent years Meetic has placed Humans and the Environment at the center of its concerns thanks to concrete actions such as a green IT approach (reduction of servers, web eco-design, zero plastic, etc.), assistance in equipment for teleworking, 1 month of Second Parent leave, etc.

Within the production IT department, you will integrate the Datawarehouse / BI division.
Much more than a simple datawarehouse, the team is at the center of Meetic's data collection and transformation in order to generate metrics and kpi on a daily basis for all of the company's businesses, from CRM to Finance, from SC to Fraud including legal, datamining and data science.

The agile manifesto of the team: Better serve the businesses, by optimizing resources and costs, in compliance with legal constraints with a reduced maintainability effort.

We are looking for people passionate about technological innovations, eager to share their skills and participate in the digital transformation of our datawarehouse towards a BigData platform in order to meet our business challenges of tomorrow.

Design and operation of secure pipelines allowing the collection, storage and use of data
Organize the data so that it is directly usable by data analysts, data scientists and end users in self-service

Enrich development best practices in the Big Data field

Big data: Dev Scala, Hadoop, MapReduce, Apache Spark, Apache Kafka
Oracle database, PostgreSQL and SQL scripts
Market ETL or ELT (Informatica, Stambia, Talent)

Analytics, dataViz and Story telling tools (Qlik, PowerBI, Tableau)
Experience Cloud (AWS, SnowFlake, BigQuery)
Notion of scheduler ($U, Airflow, Oozie)
Data catalog and data lineage tools

Community days for learning, sharing and improving

Tech culture: craft, autonomy, sharing
Learn through e-learning, conferences, Meetup and BBL
Internal hackathon several times a year
Many quality moments of sharing
An exceptional working environment in the heart of Paris (Paris IX, spacious, modern premises, rooftop, close to all transport and amenities)
An international and multicultural environment where exchanges between entities are frequent
The possibility of using our products for free thanks to the “Ambassador Pass”
Benefit from a competitive package consistent with the market

The DAP Department builds and develops decision-making applications on the basis of powerful DATA platforms for the purposes of Steering uses (data management and BI), to serve the Bank's regulatory commitments. The activity of the service is very rich and varied with business correspondents from all walks of life and therefore offers opportunities for development over time in several types of responsibilities.

This service manages the centralized data repository platforms at LCL level. You will join the Datalab and Data Platform Services and related projects service, in charge of the creation and architecture of datalabs, datamarts and associated business applications as well as the maintenance of the existing application base.

As Data Engineer:
you will contribute to the construction of Datalab and Datamart solutions under LCL's Teradata technology, in close collaboration with Architects, Business Analysts and DataScientists;
you will be at the heart of the implementation of new technologies within LCL and more broadly within the Group;
you will be in charge of the development of data collection solutions (Teradata BTEQ, TPT, SQL), their storage and processing (constitution of aggregates or scores), and their provision to DataScientists;
you will be required to develop data exposure views for analytical restitution or management tools such as MSBI or Qlik solutions;
you will participate in the implementation of the application architecture of LCL Data technologies.
You will contribute in this context to the implementation of projects in the fields of customer data, marketing analysis, etc., by intervening from the identification of the necessary data to industrialization, by dealing with all the IT aspects of implementation. in compliance with LCL procedures and methodology. You will also be responsible for contributing to compliance with Quality of Service (QOS), handling and monitoring incidents (communication, resolution and eradication, reporting). This requires a mindset of continuous improvement of applications, modeling of Datalabs and Datamarts databases and control of data access security in accordance with GDPR requirements (User Authorizations, Traceability, Right to be forgotten).

A period of training, in the technological environment, in the application architecture and in the procedures in force is planned during the period of taking up the position. Ongoing relations with the host and operator of the Crédit Agricole CAGIP Group will be your daily life, as well as relations with the LCL Business Departments: the provision of datalabs allowing them to explore the data, the datamarts serving their uses. Communication and reporting on projects are required and expected qualities.

Content:
Google Google welcomes people with disabilities.
Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience serving in the capacity of a technical sales engineer in a cloud computing environment or experience in a customer facing role.
Experience with database technologies.
Experience with data migration strategies and moving production systems.

Preferred Qualifications:
Master's degree in Computer Science or other technical field.
Experience with optimizing database performance with respect to transactional and/or analytic workloads.
Technical sales experience or professional consulting experience in the fields of systems integration, large scale data transfer/management, and enterprise database performance.
Experience in disaster recovery (DR) and data backup strategies.
Ability to quickly learn, understand, and work with new emerging technologies, methodologies, and solutions in the Cloud/IT technology space.
Ability to travel as needed.
About the job
The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what's next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.
As a Customer Engineer, you will work directly with Technical Sales teams as an enterprise database subject matter expert to differentiate and paint the roadmap of Google Cloud to our customers. You will help prospective customers and partners understand the power of Google Cloud, explaining technical features, helping customers design architectures, engage in proof of concepts, and troubleshoot potential roadblocks related to database and app migration, and data backends for new app development.
Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google's cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.
Responsibilities
Work with teams to identify and qualify business opportunities, understand key customer technical objections, and develop the strategy to resolve technical blockers.
Share in-depth storage and database expertise to support the technical relationship with Google's customers.
Work with customers to demonstrate and prototype Google Cloud product integrations in customer/partner environments.
Recommend integration strategies, enterprise architectures, platforms, and application infrastructure required to successfully implement a complete solution using best practices on Google Cloud.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form. Customer Engineer, Data Management, Google Cloud Paris (75) Experience with data migration strategies and moving production systems.
Experience in disaster recovery (DR) and data backup strategies.

Content:
Margo Conseil Our mission at Margo? Accelerate the digital transformation of our customers by supporting them in the deployment of complex IT projects.

We are a human-sized consulting firm whose objective for 15 years has been to ensure the satisfaction of our consultants as well as that of our clients. The recipe for this is simple: we carefully select our projects so that each of our employees feels stimulated and progresses quickly. This is why we have developed expertise in sectors of activity where there are strong technical constraints: multithreading, real time, performance, data volume, etc. Our consultants work with prestigious clients in market finance, insurance or energy, in large groups or successful startups.

The Margo adventure also means joining a community of 350 experts, all passionate about tech, spread between Paris, London and Warsaw. By their side, you will be able to evolve quickly and develop new skills. Ready to join us?

Example of a project proposed by Margo:

By integrating Margo, you will have the choice of the missions on which you wish to work. You will be supported by our team of Business Managers, whose role is to find the client project that best meets your expectations.
Thus, for example, you will be able to work on one of our projects to redesign from scratch a data lake within a major player in Asset Management.
The objective is to ensure the distribution of data in the optimized way to create a distribution layer and allow Data Scientists to implement use cases.
You will thus have the opportunity to evolve in a demanding environment, in agile methodology and within a team of experts, made up of 4 Spark / Scala developers, 1 data architect, 1 Ops and 1 tech lead.

As a Data Engineer, your missions will be:
Develop in agile mode the business uses based on the Datalake Hadoop
Identify and model data necessary for use
Select the most suitable storage for use among the technologies of the Hadoop ecosystem
Develop data transformation and production processing in Spark and Scala
Development of RESTful API (Scala / Play) allowing access to the data produced
Participate in continuous improvement and code refactoring

Tech stack:
Hadoop/Cloudera
Spark / Scala / Python / Java
Azure cloud
Impala / Hbase

Internal life at Margo

The projects we offer at Margo are long assignments (2 to 3 years) that will allow you to progress towards technical expertise.

You will also have the opportunity to get involved in the internal life of Margo and contribute to the growth of our community. The possibilities are numerous, you can become:

Recruiter, to technically test candidates during their recruitment process, represent Margo at school forums or propose co-optations of people from your network.
Trainer, to share your expertise and knowledge within the Margo community.
Manager, to follow on assignment and guarantee the career development of junior consultants.
Editor, to highlight your expertise and that of Margo by writing technical articles published on our blog and in the specialized press.

You are a future Margo if:

Must-Have
You come from an engineering school or an equivalent university course at Bac + 5 / Master's level.
You like to code and you are passionate about IT.
You are curious and you are interested in the latest technologies on the market.
You have a first experience as a Data Engineer.

Nice to Have
You are ambitious and not afraid to work on challenging projects in environments with strong technical constraints (high volume of data, real time, performance optimization). You ideally master multithreading.
You like working in a team and are committed to respecting good code practices.
You speak and understand English.

Our recruitment process:
Throughout the recruitment process, you have the opportunity to participate in events organized by Margo and to exchange with collaborators in order to learn more about us!

CGI Financial Services is part of the CGI Group Inc., the world's 5th largest independent information technology consulting and services company. Its 1,300 consultants combine sectoral, functional and technological expertise to support the largest companies in the finance sector (Investment and retail banking, insurance, pensions) on our Paris site but also in Luxembourg with European institutions.

Content:
KPMG Why become a Manager Data Engineer F/H at KPMG?
The professions of Audit, Consulting, Chartered Accountancy or Legal & Tax attract you and you are looking for a daily life that moves?
At the office, at the client's, in training, in our intrapreneurship incubator or with our Foundation, we offer you the stimulating environment that will allow you to express your potential, your innovative ideas and your values ​​in the service of meaningful projects. .
In contact with a diversity of 10,000 talents, meeting clients from large groups, ETIs, SMEs or start-ups, build your career within an international firm that is constantly reinventing you. Take advantage of our 220 offices in France and our presence in 150 countries to broaden your horizons.
With 200 consultants within our data center of excellence in France and a global network of more than 14,000 people, Lighthouse, our Data Analytics team supports major international accounts in their data-centric transformation projects, by developing advanced machine learning, and helping our customers lead their Data Analytics transformation.
To meet the needs of our customers and support our development, the KPMG Data & Analytics team is seeking to strengthen its workforce, and is recruiting a Data Engineer Manager, interested in the development of a data engineering and MLops offer, and equipped with strong business sensitivity.
Our Data & Analytics team works together with the Digital teams and domain specialists (Finance, Cutomer, HR, Operation, Risk, etc.)
To support our growth, we are recruiting for our Paris La Défense team a:
Data Engineer F/H
YOUR CHALLENGES
You will be integrated into our multidisciplinary team of innovative and motivated consultants, specialized in Data & Analytics and artificial intelligence issues. As such, you want to intervene operationally on consulting missions around the subjects of strategy, transformation, data modeling, and design and deployment of applications at scale, particularly in Cloud environments.
In particular, you will be in charge of participating in missions through:
Understanding the challenges and business expectations of our customers and translating them from an engineering point of view.
Collecting the needs of our clients' different businesses (Finance, Customer&Marketing, HR, Operations, Risk, etc.) in multiple business sectors (Banking, Insurance, Energy, Transport, Health, Distribution, Luxury, etc.)
Supervision of Data Engineering work by ensuring compliance with the rules
The design of specifications and/or functional specifications
Development and implementation of Data Analytics / Big Data solutions and industrialization of solutions in the form of full stack applications, often in the cloud
Acceptance, documentation and maintenance of applications.
And of course, fulfill your potential within our La Défense team, EQHO!

You are a graduate of an engineering school or a university equivalent.
You have 6 years of experience in a consulting firm or a large company

You are familiar with version management tools (Git, etc.)
You are familiar with good practices in terms of security (access protocol, rights management, encryption, etc.)
You have experience in cloud environments and virtualization technologies (Azure, Docker...)
You know how to work with business users and customers and understand their needs
You are recognized for the following qualities/skills:
You are curious, autonomous, enterprising and endowed with a good capacity for work
You have excellent interpersonal and presentation skills, and enjoy teamwork
You are dynamic, organized and methodical
You have a structured approach and a clear oral expression. You are fluent in English in a professional environment
Do you recognize yourself in this description?
… do not hesitate any longer, apply and meet us!
Location :
You will be based in La Défense, EQHO under a permanent contract.
Don't wait any longer, join a quality work environment where teamwork is key.
All of our positions are open to people with disabilities.

Content:
SFR Within the General Public department, you will join the SFR Analytics team and more particularly the “Advertising and Audience Services” division. It is a “business development” team in charge of exploiting and monetizing SFR's massive data on 2 data TV markets: TV audience and digital/TV advertising.
Within this division, the Audience team uses audience data from TV channels and develops solutions/offers. These offers are aimed at players in the TV and advertising market: TV channels, producers, advertising agencies, agencies.
Our offers, based on the exploitation of massive data, constitute alternatives to the solutions of the traditional research institutes in place, which exploit panels, with partial or declarative measurements.
In this context, the missions will be:

Standardization/Restructuring of existing modules and applications

Monitoring of data feed by the various internal (SFR network) and external (partners) data sources: live TV data, Catch up, VoD, etc.

Use of the existing base to quickly deploy new projects

Content:
Carrefour Creator of the hypermarket and pioneer of mass consumption, Carrefour remains faithful to its roots but reinvents itself to enable everyone, every day, to eat better: healthier, more local, more responsible.
Our strengths to achieve this? A multi-format network of +5,400 stores, the creation of services and a reference digital offer, enhanced cooperation with players in the agricultural world, the food chain, Tech...
And passionate employees, who are committed, challenge their profession and grow together to make the food transition a success for all.
Carrying this ambition, the IT Department is recruiting a:


Work-study student - Data Engineer (M/F)

You will report to the IT & Marketing Department - responsible for building robust and scalable data processing systems to industrialize our machine learning solutions to solve business and operational challenges like in-store outages, sales forecasting, optimization of the product assortment, personalization of the experience on the carrefour.fr website
In this context, you will be required to work as a Data Engineer on a work-study basis at:
Participate in the construction of robust and scalable data processing systems to industrialize our machine learning models, as well as tools to facilitate the life cycle of these models.

Integrated within a feature team, you will work on a daily basis with Data Scientists, Data Translators and Data Analysts.

You are preparing a diploma at BAC +5 level, in a business school, engineering school or university specializing in IT, software development, data engineering

You master SQL and Python, Bash

Location: Massy (5 min. from RER B/C).

You will have access to a wide choice of restaurants.

Content:
Zoom Work Styles at Zoom
In most cases, you will have the opportunity to choose your preferred working location from the following options when you join Zoom: in-person, hybrid or remote. Visit this page for more information about Zoom's Workstyles.
About Us
Zoomies help people stay connected so they can get more done together. We set out to build the best video product for the enterprise, and today help people communicate better with products like Zoom Contact Center, Zoom Phone, Zoom Events, Zoom Apps, Zoom Rooms, and Zoom Webinar.
We're problem-solvers, working at a fast pace to design solutions with our customers and users in mind. Here, you'll work across teams to deliver impactful projects that are changing the way people communicate and enjoy opportunities to advance your career in a diverse, inclusive environment.
You will be part of a team whose focus is to solve cutting edge AI / MLproblems and deploy models that constantly advance the state-of-the-art. You will be working on designing the data infrastructure and solve other interesting bottlenecks that are challenging at Zoom's scale.

Responsibilities:
Design and implementation of data infrastructure for Machine Learning (ML) projects for our Research and Development Org
Assembling large, complex data sets and make the data more discoverable and easy to be used by the AI ​​/ ML team to support various Machine Learning initiatives. This includes unifying pre-processing work flows for data for different AI tasks.
Build and manage data sets, also by identifying and using suitable big data technologies, such as Apache Hadoop, DVC, Apache Drill,
Write tools to transform raw data sources into easily accessible models by coding across several languages ​​such as Python, and SQL
Deploy, develop and maintain tools for data collection, data crawling and data annotation, e.g. as web applications using Django and Angular or similar technology.
Along with looking at external sources of data, build data expertise and own data quality for the pipelines you create.

Requirements:

Bachelor's or higher degree in Computer Science or related fields
Experience in building and optimizing data pipelines
Docker
Experience with AWS cloud services, e.g. S3
Experience working with large data volumes
Broad knowledge of the data infrastructure ecosystem
Knowledge of technologies like DVC or Hadoop
Good understanding of one or more of the following: Python, JavaScript, C++, Django or Angular

Please note: This job opportunity is based out of Karlsruhe, Germany
We believe that the unique contributions of all Zoomies is the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status. Zoom is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives including qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records and any qualified applicants requiring reasonable accommodations in accordance with the law. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a medical condition, or if you need assistance accessing our website or completing the application process, please let us know by emailing us at careers@zoom.us.
Zoom requires all U.S. employees who will work in person at a Zoom office, attend in-person Zoom meetings or have in-person customer meetings to be fully vaccinated. Zoom will consider requests for reasonable accommodations for religious or medical reasons as required under applicable law.
At Zoom, we care about our employees, their families, and their well-being. As part of our award-winning workplace culture and commitment to delivering happiness, our benefits program offers a variety of perks, benefits, and options to help employees maintain their physical, mental, emotional, and financial health; support work-life balance; and contribute to their community in meaningful ways. To view our benefits, click here.
Explore Zoom:
Hear from our leadership team
Browse Awards and Employee Reviews on Comparably
Visit our Blog
Zoom with us!
Find us on social at the links below and on Instagram
View more jobs, sign up for job alerts and join our talent community. Visit the Zoom careers site.

Content:
Coyote System Founded in 2005, Coyote is the European leader in connected driver assistance services and one of the largest road data aggregators. We offer solutions aimed at both individuals and businesses, with Coyote Fleet and Coyote Secure. Our vision: to believe in the power of the solidarity of its Community on the road and in that of real-time communicating technologies, to always increase driver safety.
With 5 million members in Europe, Coyote is a French company on a human scale with nearly 360 employees, in France and in several European countries.
If innovation, audacity, solidarity are values ​​that are dear to you, if you want to evolve in a fast-growing, responsible, and international company, join Coyote!

Within the Information Systems Department and under the responsibility of the Data Manager, the Data Engineer participates in the development of tools and infrastructures allowing the analysis of data, in particular by the Datalab and BI teams.
As such, your main mission is to:
Participate in the design of solutions allowing the processing of large volumes of data pipelines. These must be sufficiently secure and readable for Data Analysts and Data Scientists
Participate in the design of solutions allowing the visualization and manipulation of data by business teams
Ensure a permanent update on the technologies and languages ​​used in order to share knowledge and help the progress of the project.
Study the feasibility of requests, design and propose solution choices in collaboration with your manager and your business contacts
Participate in the different phases of the project from design to deployment
Oversee the integration of data flows
Industrialize Artificial Intelligence models

Coming from a digital background, you have at least 3 years of successful experience in data engineering with recognized technical skills in Python, C# and SQL.
You have the ability to design and implement large-scale, real-time data loading, manipulation, processing, analysis and exploration solutions.
You have a first experience on a Cloud provider, preferably Azure. In addition, skills in Databricks, NoSQL (Elasticsearch) would be appreciated.
Your sense of interpersonal skills is a real asset to succeed on a daily basis in your missions. Are you a curious, proactive person and are you able to offer solutions on a daily basis with the aim of continuously improving our services? Then apply!
This position is open to people with disabilities.

Content:
Vestiaire Collective Vestiaire Collective is the leading global online marketplace for desirable pre-loved fashion. Our mission is to transform the fashion industry for a more sustainable future by empowering our community to promote the circular fashion movement. Vestiaire was founded in 2009 and is headquartered in Paris with offices in London, Berlin, New York, Singapore and Hong Kong and warehouses in Tourcoing (France), Crawley (UK), Hong Kong and New York.
We currently have a diverse global team of 650 employees representing more than 50 nationalities. Our values ​​are community, activism, transparency, dedication and greatness. We are proud to be a BCorp.

Vestiaire Collective is looking for a Data Engineering Intern for 6 months starting in June to join our Data team in Paris
About the role
As an intern data engineer, you will join a team of Data Scientists and Data Engineers to help them improve the Data Platform and build tools to support Vestiaire Collective's usage of data.

What you'll do
Extract data from new sources (internal database, third-party sources, …)
Work on real-time pipelines (import, manipulate and serve data to support Data Scientists and Analysts)
Create APIs to serve the results of our models/analysis
Build the architecture of our tools in AWS cloud
Learn to use the newest technologies (among which AWS services, Kubernetes, Snowflake, ElasticSearch, Kafka and any technology you think can be useful) to keep the team ahead of the curve.

who you are
Currently enrolled in a Master's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or related technical field
Good level in Python (or other programming language), SQL/NoSQL and Git
A strong ability to manipulate data
A prior experience working with cloud-based technologies a plus
Problem solver with strong communication skills, a positive attitude, and empathy.
You need to be able to defend your technical choice in English. French is a plus.

What we offer
A meaningful job with an impact on the way people consume fashion and promote sustainability
The possibility to work remotely 50% of your time
The opportunity to do career defining work in a fast growing French-born scale up
The possibility to work as part of a global diverse team with more than 50 nationalities
2 days to help Project - reinforcing your activist journey and volunteer for an association
Significant investment in your learning and growth
Competitive compensation and benefits package

Content:
Foodles Foodles is the canteen only better: simpler, more generous, and friendlier! We re-enchant office life by offering a tailor-made catering solution, delivered turnkey, so that each employee can eat healthily and at a lower cost.
The guest experience and respect for the environment are at the heart of our concept, combining connected fridges accessible in self-service all day and a daily order service. We respect a strict quality charter (fresh products, peaches from responsible sectors, etc.) in order to guarantee a responsible offer.
Beyond our offer, we are committed to placing these environmental and human commitments at the heart of our team life. We want to do well, but above all to do better... and above all that our generosity does not stop at our dishes :)
Eco-responsibility: beyond our products, we are involved in adopting eco-responsible actions in order to minimize the impact of our activities.
Sharing & mutual aid: we donate our unsold products to local associations which distribute them to people in need, and we also offer our employees the opportunity to get involved in community life with the Secours Populaire.
Many other initiatives are still developing and we are counting on our future recruits to participate!

Your mission :

As a Data Analyst (M/F), you will join our Tech team to provide teams with data from the Foodles platform. Your goal is to help them in their day-to-day decision-making by providing them with accurate and relevant data. You will also make sure to make people as autonomous as possible so that you can focus on the complex subjects on which you have more added value.
You will thus join a team made up of:
8 developers
1 data analyst
1 data scientist
2 product manager
You will report directly to the CTO and actively participate in technical choices within your scope.


Your responsibilities:
To carry out your mission within Foodles, your main activities will be as follows:

You are a data analyst 60% of the time, in this context your missions are as follows:
Respond to business needs (commercial, operations, food, marketing, finance, etc.) in terms of data, namely: reporting, studies, extraction, business training
Explore data and carry out ad-hoc statistical studies in order to identify insights to help decision-making
Present the results of your analyzes to the people in the company concerned
Promote the use of data internally
You are a data engineer 40% of the time, in this context your missions are as follows:
Maintain the data warehouse in operational condition. Set up and evolve data models according to business needs.
Ensure the quality of the data made available in the datawarehouse and solve the problems detected
Follow and participate in the implementation of good development practices on the scope of the data warehouse (automated testing, integration and continuous deployment)
Participate in the evolution of the stack data when it is of technical or business interest. Today we use Stitch + DBT and we are interested in Airbyte and Airflow


Required profile :
You are the Data Analyst we need if you recognize yourself in the following profile:
Graduated from an engineering school or equivalent Bac +5 and benefit from a first similar experience of 2-3 years
You master SQL and you have already used a BI tool such as Tableau, Power BI, Data Studio, Metabase etc…
You have a good foundation in data analysis techniques, you already have experience in statistical modeling
You master the communication codes in order to democratize Data in business, you know how to popularize technical subjects to a non-technical public
You are rigorous and like to deepen the subjects
You are curious and resourceful, you like to explore and learn about subjects that are unknown to you
You are a lover of good food, in the stove and/or in front of your plate

With equal skills, Foodles gives priority to people with disabilities and other beneficiaries of the employment obligation.

Why join our adventure?
A dynamic and over-motivated team in which you will gain autonomy and responsibilities
Meals at very low prices (really … mini), every lunchtime
50% of the transport ticket reimbursed
Super well located and very accessible offices & the possibility of telecommuting up to 4 days a week!
And many other benefits ;) Data Analyste (H/F) 92110 Clichy Participate in the evolution of the stack data when it is of technical or business interest.
We respect a strict quality charter (fresh products,…

Content:
McKinsey & Company Who You'll Work With
This internship is an opportunity only for the final year master's degree students and lasts 6 months. Start dates offered are throughout the whole year.
Based in Paris and working across the region, as a consultant data scientist you will work closely with our clients, data engineers and all types of McKinsey consultants on interdisciplinary projects, using maths, stats and machine learning to derive structure and knowledge from raw data across various industry sectors.
This hybrid client-facing/technical role will allow you to use state of the art technologies to solve highly impactful business problems, whilst also leveraging your strong communication skills to convey complex intractable ideas to non-technical audiences.
who you are
This final year 6-month internship position is for a data scientist with strong intrinsic technical ability and an aptitude for solving complex problems using technology.
A core value at QuantumBlack is fusion and at the heart of our multi-disciplinary teams is the belief that the sum of individual parts will always be less than the impact of the entire team. You are a highly collaborative individual who is capable of laying aside your own agenda, listening to and learning from colleagues, challenging thoughtfully and prioritizing impact. You search for ways to improve things and work collaboratively with colleagues. You believe in iterative change, experimenting with new approaches, learning and improving to move forward quickly. Trust between colleagues is paramount here – you are an individual who can always be trusted to work in the best interests of all colleagues and to achieve the best outcome for QuantumBlack and our clients. You are naturally enthusiastic and enjoy sharing your passion with others.
What You'll Do
As a Data Science Intern with the Paris office...
You will work in multi-disciplinary environments harnessing data to provide real-world impact for organizations globally.
You will influence many of the recommendations our clients need to positively change their businesses and enhance performance.
Role responsibilities
Work on complex and extremely varied data sets from some of the world’s largest organizations to solve real world problems
Develop data science products and solutions for clients as well as for our data science team
Write highly optimized code to advance our internal Data Science Toolbox
Work in a multi-disciplinary environment with specialists in machine learning, engineering and design
Add real-world impact to your academic expertise, as you are encouraged to write ‘black’ papers and present at meetings and conferences should you wish
Attend conferences such as NIPS and ICML as one global team as well as Data Science retrospectives where you will have the opportunity to share and learn from your co-workers.
Work within one of the largest and most advanced data science teams in Europe, support the Lead Data Scientists to develop data science products
What you'll learn
How successful projections on real world problems across a variety of industries are completed through referencing past deliveries of end to end machine learning pipelines
Build products alongside the core engineering team and evolve the engineering process to scale with data, handling complex problems and advanced client situations
Be able to focus on modeling by working alongside the Data Engineering team which focuses on the wrangling, clean-up and transformation of data.
Best practices in software development and productionise machine learning by working with our Machine Learning Engineering teams which optimizes code for model development and scale it
Work with our UX and Visual Design teams to interpret your complex models into stunning and user-focused visualizations
Using new technologies and problem-solving skills in a multicultural and creative environment
You will work on the frameworks and libraries that our teams of Data Scientists and Data Engineers use to progress from data to impact. You will guide global companies through data science solutions to transform their businesses and enhance performance across industries including healthcare, automotive, energy and elite sport.
Real-World Impact – No project is ever the same; we work across multiple sectors, providing unique learning and development opportunities internationally.
Fusing Tech & Leadership – We work with the latest technologies and methodologies and offer first class learning programs at all levels.
Multidisciplinary Teamwork - Our teams include data scientists, engineers, project managers, UX and visual designers who work collaboratively to enhance performance.
Innovative Work Culture – Creativity, insight and passion come from being balanced. We cultivate a modern work environment through an emphasis on wellness, insightful talks and training sessions.

Content:
SUEZ Type of Contract
Regular / Permanent
WHO ARE WE
With 35,000 employees on five continents, SUEZ is a world leader in intelligent and sustainable resource management. The Group provides water and waste management solutions that allow cities and industries to optimize the management of their resources and improve their environmental and economic performance.

YOUR MISSION
The Senior Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer will have the primary mission of
lead and execute ambitious data science projects and transform these projects into tangible solutions for improving the performance of our operational staff or improving customer satisfaction.

These objectives will be achieved through the deployment and scaling up of data projects supporting the group's business strategy. For this, the recruited person must:
collect the needs reported by our businesses
maintain a high-level internal and external cooperation network
produce communications, develop and support the evolution of algorithms from the idea to the deployment, of its team and the community.

Statistical modeling
machine learning

Content:
Margo Conseil Our mission at Margo Analytics? Support the Data and Cloud transformation of our customers by combining ROI and technological innovation.

We are a human-sized consulting firm whose objective is to ensure the satisfaction of our consultants as much as that of our clients. The recipe for this is simple: we carefully select our projects so that each of our employees feels stimulated and progresses quickly. This is why we have developed expertise in the latest Data and Cloud technologies in business sectors where there are strong technical constraints (Banking, Insurance, Industry, Energy and Retail).

The Margo Analytics adventure also means joining a community of 350 experts from the Margo group, all passionate about tech, spread between Paris, London and Warsaw. By their side, you will be able to evolve quickly and develop new skills. Ready to join us?

Example of a project proposed by Margo Analytics:
By integrating Margo Analytics, you will have the choice of the missions on which you wish to work. You will be accompanied by the 2 founders of the company, whose role is to find the client project that will best meet your expectations and to support you in your career.
Thus, for example, you will be able to work on one of our projects to co-create a Data Platform on Azure Databricks within a major player in Asset Management.
The objective is to ensure the distribution of data in an optimized way to create a distribution layer and allow business entities to implement use cases.
You will thus have the opportunity to evolve in a very demanding environment, in agile methodology and within a team of experts.
As a Data Engineer, your missions will be:
Develop in agile mode the business uses based on the Datalake Hadoop
Participate in the MoveToCloud to Azure project
Identify and model data necessary for use
Select the most suitable storage for use among the technologies of the Databricks ecosystem
Develop data transformation and production processing in Python and Scala
Participate in continuous improvement and code refactoring
Tech stack:
Hadoop / Spark / Kafka
Scala / Python
Databricks
Azure cloud
Internal life at Margo Analytics
The projects we offer at Margo Analytics are long missions (2 to 3 years) that will allow you to evolve towards technical expertise.
You will also have the opportunity to get involved in the development and strategy of Margo Analytics and help grow our community. The possibilities are numerous and very quickly we offer you to have a 2nd role within the structure:
Recruiter, to discuss technical matters with candidates during their recruitment process, represent Margo Analytics at school forums or suggest referrals from people in your network.
Trainer, to share your expertise and knowledge within the Margo Analytics community.
Manager, to follow on assignment and guarantee the career development of junior consultants.
Editor, to highlight your expertise and that of Margo Analytics by writing technical articles published on our blog and in the specialized press.
Speaker, to speak and propose debates at internal or external conferences
You are a future Margo if:
Must-Have:
You come from an engineering school or an equivalent university course at Bac + 5 / Master's level.
You like to code and you are passionate about IT and Data.
You are curious and you are interested in the latest technologies on the market.
You have a first experience as a Data Engineer.
You have a good level in Python or Scala development and have a minimum knowledge of Big Data (Spark in particular);
Nice to Have:
You are ambitious and are not afraid to work on challenging projects in environments with strong technical constraints (high volume of data, real time, performance optimization).
You like working in a team and are committed to respecting good code practices.
You speak and understand English.
Knowledge of Azure Databricks is a plus.

Our recruitment process:
Apply online! The HR team carefully studies your application and contacts you if your profile matches one of our positions.
First meeting! You discuss with an HR and one of the partners of Margo Analytics on your background, your professional aspirations as well as on Margo Analytics and the opportunities we offer.
Challenge yourself in a technical interview with one of our experts. This is also an opportunity for you to have his feedback.
Last motivation interview: to finish, you meet a m Margo Analytics - Data Engineer – H/F Paris (75) Support the Data and Cloud transformation of our customers by combining ROI and technological innovation.
We are a human-sized consulting firm whose…

Content:
CGI Inc Position Description:
At CGI, a world leader in consulting and digital services, we are convinced that digital and innovation are great levers for accelerating the transformation of society and putting technology at the service of as many people as possible.

Our 78,000 experts around the world, including 11,000 in France, support companies and administrations on a daily basis from strategy to the implementation of their IT transformation to make them more efficient, so many issues that will punctuate your daily life alongside of our professionals.

We have combined industrial capabilities and high-level expertise in the most innovative digital technologies to create a digital innovation center with the aim of supporting large companies in getting the most out of digital.
Your future duties and responsibilities:
You are passionate about the field of Data and already have significant experience on data engineering issues: construction of data pipelines (batch/streaming), industrialization of data science applications, database modeling, etc.
You have solid knowledge of data architectures and the cloud. You are certified and/or have experience in one or more cloud data environments (GCP, Azure, AWS, etc.) and you master the following two languages: SQL, Python.

Do you want to diversify your skills to always be at the forefront of new technologies and want to join an entity specializing in data and innovation (> 200 consultants)? You will evolve on large-scale national and international projects, in varied business environments with a high level of responsibility. You will also have the opportunity to build skills on other Cloud tools than those of your initial area of ​​expertise.

As a Data Engineer, you will be integrated into a pool of consultants specializing in Data involved in stimulating projects.
Your missions will be:
Analyze, advise, and make recommendations in order to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the solutions implemented
Work in collaboration with technical engineers and other experts to research and provide answers to technical issues
Carry out solution implementation work (preparation of data, industrialization of models, communications between the different technologies, etc.)
Produce projects in agile mode with latest generation development processes and tools (DevOps, Git, CI/CD, etc.)
Participate in the development and revision of standards / technical documentation
Facilitate internal training. Support the skills development of teams
Provide technical support to Data teams and customers on a daily basis

Accompanied and surrounded by a passionate Data community, exchange, sharing and training will offer you a real space to flourish. The proximity and the personalized follow-up of your manager, then a good number of events throughout the year, will further strengthen the conviviality and the team spirit!

With a successful integration, many possibilities for career development will quickly be offered to you, in the animation of the technical sector or in the consulting of Data solutions.
Required qualifications to be successful in this role:
Passionate about IT and data, you like teamwork, learning and sharing. You are also endowed with a bold and ambitious spirit. You show initiative and work for the long term. You justify 2 to 5 years of professional experience within a digital services company or a consulting firm in the field of Data Engineering. You have a broad vision of technologies and you master at least one Data technology in the Cloud.

CGI is an inclusive and responsive employer for people with disabilities.
What you can expect from us:
Combining knowledge and doing

As technology is at the heart of our customers' digital transformation, we know that people are at the heart of business success.

When you join CGI, you become a trusted advisor, collaborating with colleagues and clients to deliver actionable insights that produce real, lasting results. We call our employees "members" because they are shareholders and owners of CGI. They enjoy working and growing together to build a company we are proud of. It's been our dream since 1976. It's brought us to where we are today – one of the largest independent information technology (IT) and management consulting firms in the world.

At CGI, we recognize the richness that diversity brings to us. We aspire to create a culture in which we all belong and Data Engineer Cloud Data H/F Paris (75) Analyze, advise, and make recommendations in order to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the solutions implemented.

Location: Nanterre, FR
Company: Plastic Omnium
Hungry for challenges? Join a group with innovation at its heart and contribute to the automotive revolution!
With 31,000 team members located in 26 countries and with a 2021 revenue of €8 billion, Plastic Omnium is world leader in intelligent exterior systems, clean energy systems and front-end modules.

Coming from an engineering school course, you master at least one programming language applied to data analysis (SQL, Python, etc.) and demonstrate a real appetite for Big Data.
You are able to work independently as well as in a team. Force of proposal, you have excellent communication skills (written and oral) and speak English fluently.
Do you recognize yourself in this profile and share our values, namely the entrepreneurial spirit and the passion for our profession? Then send us your application!
Plastic Omnium is careful to treat all applications equally, including those from people with disabilities.

Duration: 1 to 2 years
Start: September 2022
Location: Nanterre, I-Tech (92)

Content:
Crédit Agricole Assurances Job Description
BU/SU environment:
Crédit Agricole Assurances is preparing for tomorrow. In a context of digital transformation marked by new technologies (Chatbot, Datascience) and new working methods (such as agility), we want to strengthen our teams within the IT division. We are looking for curious profiles, open to innovation, motivated by change and committed to transformation. Join our IT department and work in a dynamic, stimulating environment of a group with very strong growth.

Context and objective of the position:
We are looking for an apprentice Data engineer to strengthen the Data platform development teams.

As the Data platform aims to develop data capacities and uses to serve its internal and external customers, its program within the framework of the One 2025 corporate project is ambitious in order to meet the challenges of the world of tomorrow.

In a scaled agile ecosystem, you will integrate a squad of capabilities or uses and develop your skills in development and agile methodology.

Duties:
And concretely, what is it about on the ground? Alongside a technical expert, you will have the opportunity to work on the following missions:
Integrate volumes of various sizes of data from various sources into the data platform (in batch or in real time),
Develop the capacities of the technical base necessary for the integration of use cases in the platform,
Transform data through different cleaning, normalization, and enrichment processes,
Optimize the processing and automation of data collection,
Store and make data available to the various businesses,
Prepare data so that it can be used by Data Scientists (application of algorithms),
Implement high-performance Big Data algorithms (classification, regression, clustering),
Contribute to design and modeling work,
Ensure the usability of the solution (deployment pipeline, test automation, code quality, etc.),
Apply data management standards
Carry out maintenance activities (production monitoring, incident management, corrective and evolutionary maintenance).

As part of your job, you will, of course, be accompanied and integrated by the team for a gradual increase in skills.

Are you still hesitating to join us?
Know that people are at the heart of our Business Project in order to "act every day in the interest of our customers and society", the raison d'être of our group.

And after ?
By joining CAA, you also join the Crédit Agricole SA Group and there are just as many opportunities available to you in the context of your career.
So take part in the adventure!

Application criteria
Duration
12 to 24 months
Frame / No Frame
Non-executive
Minimum level of study
Bac + 3 / L3
Training / Specialization
You are training as an engineer specializing in data.
Minimum experience level
0 - 2 years
Soft skills
You follow theoretical training in software development (specialized in data).
Your personality is just as important as your technical skills.
In full organizational and technological transformation, we are looking for open, curious, agile profiles, ready to support our challenges!
You certainly have the profile we are looking for!
Company Credit Agricole Assurances
Crédit Agricole Assurances supports its customers – individuals, professionals, farmers and companies – at every moment of their lives, through three business lines (Savings/Retirement, Provident/Borrower/Collectives, Damages). We offer them a complete range of products and services distributed in the regional banks of Crédit Agricole and at LCL. Thanks to our bank-insurance model, our expertise and the commitment of our 5,300 employees, in France and in 7 countries, we are the leading insurer in France and the leading bank-insurer in Europe. Our company is committed to a policy in favor of the integration and continued employment of people with disabilities. ALTERNANCE - Data engineer H/F Paris (75) You are training as an engineer specializing in data.
You follow theoretical training in software development (specialized in data).

Content:
Ekimetrics Ekimetrics is the European leader in data science with + 320 data scientists and +1000 projects since 2006. Present in Paris, London, NY and HK, we carry out projects in +50 countries and for all sectors of activity: financial services, Retail , Telecom, Health, etc.
Our mission is to help companies audit their data opportunities, enrich their analytical capital, and deploy actionable solutions to maximize their marketing and operational performance, and re-energize business models.
Our absolute focus is to deliver short-term gains, while guaranteeing the development of our clients' data capital in the long term.
We are committed to providing the most advanced data science approaches, and to building ethical and sustainable AI practices.
Some key figures :
14 years of experience in Data Science
+320 data scientists, all consultants
4 offices in Paris, London, New York & Hong Kong
+350 customers (CAC40, Fortune500)
+$1M profit generated for our clients since 2006
+1000 Data Science projects
The team:
Our team, "Product Engineering", designs innovative, intuitive, data-centric and Data Science applications to help our customers make relevant decisions.
By combining our expertise in data analysis and our user-oriented approach, we offer tailor-made solutions to meet the needs of our customers, while integrating into their IT environments.
We benefit from an exciting ecosystem: a team of data scientists and strategic data projects for the largest companies in the world.
Our team is currently composed of 10 developers, 1 lead tech, 1 UX designer and 2 project managers.
The post :
Passionate about application development, you want to join a stimulating work environment, participate in several projects around data science. Your missions will be the following:
Development of python assets (API, algorithms) of our core business
Participate in package architecture choices and micro-service splitting
Define the deployment and continuous integration processes of our libraries
Put into production ML algorithms developed by data scientists
Write technical documentation to share your work with the team
The position is part of the development of an ambitious internal solution. You will be part of a team of developers with complementary skills and will benefit from great autonomy where initiative is encouraged. Our projects are carried out from our premises, which allows us to work together and share our best practices.

Required profile :
Graduate of an engineering school or a university degree, you have at least 3 years of experience in a software engineer position or equivalent.
You have experience on complex back-end projects, bonus for a data back-end
You are fluent in Python, Fast API, Jupiter, Databricks, Pandas.
You have knowledge of cloud deployment on Azure or Google Cloud.
You master the entire development cycle of an application and you deliver production ready code
Like all the members of our teams, you are passionate about data and wish to participate in the development of a major player in this field

Why join us?
Use of the latest technologies
A team of developers involved, motivated, who take pleasure every day and who will support your skills development
Internal training on Data and Consulting topics
Strong corporate culture and stimulating work environment
Pleasant working environment
Collaboration with talented teams on challenging projects, allowing you to quickly build skills,
Join an innovative and fast-growing company, whose culture is based on excellence and knowledge sharing.
Our values
Excellence: continuously improving and delivering results ever closer to perfection, both in substance and form
Creativity: imagining unexpected solutions, creating disruption and getting out of your comfort zone
Transmission: working together with generosity, promoting collective intelligence, sharing know-how, helping colleagues grow
Curiosity: desire to discover, to learn, exploratory spirit and audacity
Pleasure: to share and celebrate successes in a positive and benevolent atmosphere, pleasure to transmit one's know-how and pleasure to innovate
As an employer, Ekimetrics offers everyone the same employment opportunities without distinction of gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, social status, disability and age. Ekimetrics strives to develop an inclusive work environment that reflects the diversity in its teams. Software Engineer Python (H/F/N) - Paris Paris (75) +320 data scientists, all consultants.

Content:
TOTAL DIGITAL FACTORY In accordance with the company's HSE policies and those of the Digital Factory, the Data Engineer will join the Be:Mo Tech team.


The Be:Mo Tech team is developing a mobility platform that connects networks (service stations, electric charging stations, car parks) on the one hand, and B2B customers on the other via their apps or connected vehicles. We offer this platform in the form of a Saas-type offer, with high-level APIs, to address a growing market.

Be:Mo Tech is organized in "squads" of human size, autonomous and responsible for specific functional areas.
As a Data Engineer, your role is to guarantee the product's data pipelines, to ensure the development of programs to collect, prepare, transform and disseminate data.

Duties:
Design data pipelines (batch/streaming) using Python, Spark, Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL Server technologies and languages…
Set up resilient and secure data systems (data lake, real-time systems, data warehouse) on the cloud
Master good monitoring and alerting practices around data flows.
Collaborate with data scientists for the realization of prediction models.
Ensure technological watch on data architectures and new technologies.
Profile
Profile :

You have a higher education at Bac+5 level.

You have at least 4 years of experience in data engineering with recognized technical skills in Python and SQL.

You have the ability to design and implement large-scale data loading, manipulation, processing, analysis and exploration solutions.
You have a first experience on a Cloud provider, preferably Azure.

Skills would be appreciated in Spark, NoSQL (Azure CosmosDB, MongoDB, etc.).

Experience in data visualization (PowerBI).

You have a working level of English.

Venue
Paris 02
Candidate criteria
Education level min. required
4- Masters or MBA

You will join the IT Department, which brings together all the IT departments in charge of developing and operating the Bank's information system and technological infrastructure.

You will carry out your work-study program in an international environment, alongside your tutor who will support you in your learning and in the development of your professional network.
Joining Crédit Agricole CIB means benefiting from a large community of young people, working on a modern campus offering many services (bakery, gym, etc.), benefiting from HR monitoring (welcome morning, monitoring regular, etc.) and work-study opportunities, VIE, CDD and CDI.

Content:
Subject: Position: Applications Architect | ITEL || Jacksonville FL – Remote to start || Client: NAGARRO || ITEL \\
Contract 
From: vishal.c@emonics.com
To: assansanogo@gmail.com
Date Sent: Friday, April 15, 2022 2:21:47 PM GMT-07:00
Date Received: Friday, April 15, 2022 1:53:05 PM GMT-07:00

Hi,
We have an urgent position for Solution/Application Architect as below JD.

Position: Applications Architect | ITEL
Location: Jacksonville FL – Remote to start
Client: NAGARRO || ITEL
Please let me know if you are interested or sharwe the updated resume along with rate expectation.

Overview:
The applications architect is responsible for creating/maintaining application architectures, primarily in cloud-
native solutions on Microsoft Azure and other leading PaaS solutions. The responsibilities include overseeing the
design and development of software applications, collaborate on application design with internal stakeholders
and application development teams (internal, external, partners and vendors) implement and monitor application
development stages, and document application architectures / designs.

Primary Responsibilities:
*Architect cloud-native applications based on scalable, portable, and resilient designs on Microsoft Azure and
other leading cloud platforms
*Apply design patterns, domain-driven design, component-based architecture, and evolutionary architecture
*Apply cloud-native architecture concepts and best practices for high availability, scalability, resilience,
performance, and security requirements in the cloud 
*Develop a roadmap for migrating a monolithic application to a micro-service architecture
*Review platforms and suggest improvements in automation, continuous integration/continuous deployment
(CI/CD) practices, security, and platform services
*Communicate effectively through strong written and oral communication skills for technical and non-technical
audiences
*Integrate with non-cloud technologies and third-party vendor products/services
*Drive evaluation of different platforms, gather information on differences in cloud-native implementations, and
conduct research on the platform behavior under different workloads

Skills/Qualifications:
*Bachelor’s degree in software development, scientific, business or technical background or equivalent
combination of industry related professional experience and education.
*12+ years overall IT industry experience
*At least 5+ years in a solution/application architect role using service and hosting solutions such as
private/public cloud IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS platforms
*Experience in architecting and designing technical solutions leveraging Microsoft Azure IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS
capabilities
*Experience in leading modernization of legacy applications, working with 3rd party providers, internal and
external development teams that are geographically dispersed 
*Experience/Knowledge in Azure Resources/Services: Azure App Services, Azure Functions, Azure Logic Apps,
AKS, Azure storage, Service Bus, Azure SQL Database, Redis Cache, Azure Search, Azure Monitor, Application
Insights, Key Vault, Cosmos DB, Azure DevOps, API Management, ARM templates, and general cloud

time of crisis.

I'm working with a major ENGINEERING POSITION in Jacksonville FL – Initial Remote, and we are hiring
Applications Architect for Full Time role.

to visit with you about it.

Please let us know when you are free for a quick call, or you can also reach us at (201) 479-9083 at your
convenience.

Position: Applications Architect
Location: Jacksonville FL – Initial Remote
Duration:  Contract/Full Time 

Overview:
The applications architect is responsible for creating/maintaining application architectures, primarily in cloud-
native solutions on Microsoft Azure and other leading PaaS solutions. The responsibilities include overseeing the
design and development of software applications, collaborate on application design with internal stakeholders
and application development teams (internal, external, partners and vendors) implement and monitor application
development stages, and document application architectures / designs.

Primary Responsibilities:
•    Architect cloud-native applications based on scalable, portable, and resilient designs on Microsoft Azure and
other leading cloud platforms
•    Apply design patterns, domain-driven design, component-based architecture, and evolutionary architecture
•    Apply cloud-native architecture concepts and best practices for high availability, scalability, resilience,
performance, and security requirements in the cloud 
•    Develop a roadmap for migrating a monolithic application to a micro-service architecture
•    Review platforms and suggest improvements in automation, continuous integration/continuous deployment
(CI/CD) practices, security, and platform services
•    Communicate effectively through strong written and oral communication skills for technical and non-technical
audiences
•    Integrate with non-cloud technologies and third-party vendor products/services
•    Drive evaluation of different platforms, gather information on differences in cloud-native implementations, and
conduct research on the platform behaviour under different workloads

Skills/Qualifications:
•    Bachelor’s degree in software development, scientific, business, or technical background or equivalent
combination of industry related professional experience and education.
•    12+ years overall IT industry experience
•    At least 5+ years in a solution/application architect role using service and hosting solutions such as
private/public cloud IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS platforms
•    Experience in architecting and designing technical solutions leveraging Microsoft Azure IaaS, PaaS, and
SaaS capabilities
•    Experience in leading modernization of legacy applications, working with 3rd party providers, internal and
external development teams that are geographically dispersed 
•    Experience/Knowledge in Azure Resources/Services: Azure App Services, Azure Functions, Azure Logic
Apps, AKS, Azure storage, Service Bus, Azure SQL Database, Redis Cache, Azure Search, Azure Monitor,
Application Insights, Key Vault, Cosmos DB, Azure DevOps, API Management, ARM templates, and general
cloud governance and security mechanisms
•    Experience in analysing legacy applications and re-architecting them as applications fit to be deployed on

Hi,

Hope you are doing great.
Please go through job description and let me know your response.

 Job Descriptions : Data Scientist - MI/AL
Location – Remote/ Secaucus, NJ
Contract to hire role – Need visa independent candidates only)

Responsibilities
• Design and develop solutions to address specific business priorities and objectives using data science methods including machine
learning, deep learning, and other advanced analysis
• Research innovative data science approaches and methodologies in academia and industry
• Coordinate and collaborate with cross-functional partners (data engineers, QA, business analysts) within HTAS to build pipelines and
ensure proper data is used for models
• Participate in architectural and solution design discussion as they relate to data science solutions
• Conduct exploratory data analysis and build proofs of concept to test ideas, uncover trends and relationships, and unlock insights
• Advance enterprise understanding of data science and fluency in advanced analytics capabilities
• Coordinate and collaborate with cross-functional analytics professionals throughout the organization to augment and accelerate data-
driven insights
• Interrogate and develop remediation approaches for data and model bias, overall quality, and drift
• Communicate and interpret models for technical and non-technical business stakeholders
• Perform exploratory data analysis to profile and baseline data
• Assess and develop analytic methodologies to improve data quality
• Develop data visualizations to convey analytics insights
• Support application development teams in the deployment and operationalize of data analytics and data visualization solutions

Required Work Experience: • Foundational understanding of descriptive statistics • Experience in Python
programming. • Experience in applying data-driven statistical analysis & modelling solutions • Experience in
regression modelling, gradient boosting, optimization and tuning, and neural networks. • Experience with large
scale ML or modeling system experience using AWS SageMaker, API and Microservices. • 3-5 years of data
science and AI/ML development experience • Demonstrable experience with function-oriented or class-oriented
programming • 1+ years of experience developing analytics solutions in a cloud environment (AWS, Azure or
GCP) using modern data science tools and libraries • Experience in storytelling and communicating model
results and data insights to lay audiences • Experience developing data visualizations using COTS (e.g.,
Tableau) or data visualization libraries (e.g., ggplot, matplotlib, bokeh)
